0.title: 2 men cheat Pune bank of ₹65 lakh by securing loan on forged docs
0.article_body: Two people allegedly cheated a private bank of ₹65 lakh by procuring loans using forged documents, reports said. In his complaint, the bank manager said that the accused used forged ITR documents and manipulated bank statements to apply for the loan. According to police sub-inspector S Girnar, one of the accused is associated with three more bank loan fraud cases.

1.title: 9-year-old boy dies as part of balcony collapses in Delhi's Rohini
1.article_body: A nine-year-old boy died after a portion of the balcony of an old house collapsed in the Begum Vihar area of Delhi's Rohini, police said. According to Rohini DCP Pranav Tayal, the boy was playing in front of the house when the incident took place. He was taken to a hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries, the DCP added.

2.title: Siblings impersonate beggars to commit theft, arrested in Mumbai
2.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested three people who pretended to be beggars and stole from multiple households, reports have stated. The accused, identified as Satyababa (40), Nisha (22) and Pooja (25), are siblings who hail from Maharashtra's Ahmednagar and had travelled to Mumbai along with a child with an intent to commit theft. They have been placed under judicial custody.

3.title: Rahul Gandhi stops car, helps man injured in road accident in Kerala; video surfaces
3.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi recently helped a man injured in road accident in Kerala's Wayanad, a video of which has surfaced online. Rahul stopped his car on seeing the injured man and helped in taking him to a hospital in his convoy's ambulance. The video shows him helping with the stretcher while the man was being taken to the ambulance.

4.title: BJP govt in K'taka trying to communalise school curriculum: Sinha
4.article_body: The opposition candidate for the Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, on Sunday said that the BJP government in Karnataka was attempting to communalise the school curriculum in the state. He accused the Central government of launching repeated assaults on democracy and secularism. He added that the Centre has "unleashed poisonous communal propaganda to divide India's multi-religious society".

5.title: Johnny Depp gets tattoo of broken arrow post defamation case win
5.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp got a tattoo of a broken arrow on his underwrist a month after winning the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. The process reportedly took six hours. As per reports, a broken arrow signifies "a new start and new hope" after "burying the battle ax". Pictures and videos of Depp getting the tattoo are going viral.

6.title: BJP MP asks Raj CM to get mental treatment after nikamma remark for Minister
6.article_body: BJP MP Ashok Bajpai took a jibe at Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot for calling Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat "nikamma", saying that the CM should get mental treatment. He added that the CM's old age is visible in his conduct, adding that Shekhawat has worked hard to provide tap water in a short period of time.

7.title: Russia claims full control of Ukraine's Luhansk region as its last city falls
7.article_body: Russia on Sunday said it has taken control of eastern Ukraine's Luhansk region after the fall of the region's last Ukrainian holdout. The city of Lysychansk, which was a key Ukrainian city, and some nearby settlements fell under the control of Russian forces on Sunday, Russia claimed. Ukraine is, however, yet to comment on Russian claims.

8.title: 22-yr-old law student killed, his body thrown in UP drain; police probe role of gay app
8.article_body: Yash Rastogi, a 22-year-old law student, was killed and his body was thrown in a drain in gunny bag in UP's Meerut, police said. Three accused, reportedly identified as Shavej, Imran and Salman, have been arrested. Police are investigating the role of a gay app they were associated with amid reports that Yash blackmailed the accused with their objectionable video.

9.title: 200 families left homeless in Assam's Barpeta as river wipes out houses
9.article_body: Over 200 families in the Kachumara area of Assam's Barpeta district have been forced to move to other safer places after the Brahmaputra river wiped out their houses and several bighas of land. "Many roads of this area are also damaged due to river erosion," a local resident said. So far, at least 174 have died in Assam amid floods.

10.title: B'wood is playing safe by remaking films & not creating original content: Neil
10.article_body: Actor Neil Nitin Mukesh said that Bollywood tries to ‘play it safe’ by remaking films and not creating original content. "There are various sub-genres, like psychological thrillers, political thrillers, horror thrillers and so on. Why aren’t we exploring those?" he added. "We are still remaking films instead of coming up with original ideas and content," Neil said.

11.title: Akhilesh like Mughal emperors who oppressed kin for power: BJP MP
11.article_body: BJP MP Dinesh Lal Yadav on Sunday likened SP chief Akhilesh Yadav to the Mughal emperors, who he said oppressed their kin for the sake of power. "Reawakened Muslim and Yadav voters after 2014 have shattered the hope of the SP, which used to claim a monopoly over them," he said. SP is turning into a "samaptwadi party," he added.

12.title: AAP expanding in Guj, people tired of 27 yrs of BJP: Kejriwal
12.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that AAP is expanding on a huge scale in Gujarat, adding that the people of the state are tired of 27 years of the BJP. "BJP thinks Congress can't replace them, so they've developed ego. People are looking with hope towards AAP this time," he said.

13.title: BJP govt's policy is Gandhi in abroad & Godse in India: Yechury
13.article_body: CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury has criticised Centre for dismissing a US panel's recent report on religious freedom in India. "Policy of BJP government is Gandhi in abroad and Godse in...[India]...On one hand, [they] want to tell everyone that we have...democracy...and on the other, they're crushing...democratic rights inside [India]," he said. Panel had termed India a "country of particular concern".

14.title: Was confused about my tactics: Top seed Swiatek on 3rd round Wimbledon loss
14.article_body: Commenting on her third round loss against unseeded Alize Cornet at Wimbledon, world number one Iga Swiatek, who was on a 37-match winning streak, said she was confused about her tactics. "What can I say? I know I didn't play good tennis," she added. The top seed hit 33 unforced errors to Cornet's seven in the 6-4, 6-2 defeat.

15.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, disrupts traffic in several parts of Delhi
15.article_body: Heavy rainfall lashed parts of Delhi, leading to traffic disruption and waterlogging in many parts on Sunday, as part of an ongoing wet spell with the onset of monsoon. Areas like Mandi House, Tilak Marg and Pragati Maidan were reportedly flooded after the rainfall. Delhi had received heavy rainfall on Thursday, which brought the temperature below 30 degrees Celsius.

16.title: Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary share first pic of daughter
16.article_body: Television actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary shared the first picture of their baby girl on social media on Sunday. The couple can be seen kissing their daughter's cheeks as she looks into the camera. Debina wrote, "Introducing Lianna. Our heart united into one." Lianna is Debina and Gurmeet's first child together and was born on April 3.

17.title: Tiger Shroff shares throwback training video, says 'The struggle was real'
17.article_body: Tiger Shroff, taking to Instagram, shared a throwback video from his acrobatics training session. "Man the struggle and grind [were] real! Found some old training footage of little me with not so little dreams and my quest to become...action hero," he wrote. Actor Bhakhtyar Irani reacted to the video, writing, "When he was a cub...looked dangerous to kill even then."

18.title: We don't make family entertainers due to influence by the West: Varun
18.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan stated in an interview that Bollywood has stopped making big-scale masala family entertainers because it is too influenced by the West. "No one knows what type of films will work, from the biggest producers to trade people," he added. The actor further said that after COVID-19, one has to do "what your conviction says".

19.title: Ronaldo wants to leave Man Utd; doesn't feel ambition: Italian journalist
19.article_body: Italian transfer journalist Fabrizio Romano has claimed that Manchester United footballer Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave the English football club. "Ronaldo told Manchester United [that] he wants to leave this summer as he wants to see more ambition," Romano tweeted. He added that the 37-year-old footballer likes the club and its manager but doesn't feel the ambition.

20.title: I can hurt him on grass court: Nadal's next opponent Botic on their match
20.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal's next opponent at Wimbledon Botic van de Zandschulp has said he can defeat the two-time Wimbledon champion on the grass court in their fourth-round match. "The biggest challenge in tennis is to play Nadal at French Open...but [I've] more confidence here to really make a shot...I can hurt him on the grass court," stated Zandschulp.

21.title: Media loves to write that I'm bad for tennis but clearly not: Kyrgios
21.article_body: Talking about his third round win against fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas at Wimbledon, unseeded Australian Nick Kyrgios said, "Hell of an atmosphere and an amazing match. I honestly felt like the favourite coming [into this match]." He added, "Everywhere I go I seem to be having full stadiums...media loves to write that I'm bad for the sport but clearly not."

22.title: 4 killed, 3 injured as cylinder explodes during Punjab wedding function
22.article_body: Four persons, including three women and one girl, were killed and three sustained injuries after a cylinder exploded during a wedding function in Punjab's Fazilka district. The explosion was caused due to a leak in the regulator of a gas cylinder, according to police. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at a hospital, police added.

23.title: 10-year-old rape victim denied abortion in US' Ohio after SC ends abortion rights
23.article_body: A 10-year-old rape victim was denied an abortion in Ohio after the Supreme Court of the US overturned the Roe vs Wade decision last month. A child abuse doctor in Ohio contacted an obstetrician-gynecologist in Indiana, after receiving the girl who was six weeks and three days pregnant. She is now travelling to Indiana for an abortion, the Hill reported.

24.title: 'Pushpa' composer DSP, Honey Singh team up for Salman's Bhaijaan: Reports
24.article_body: Music composer Devi Sri Prasad aka DSP, who composed music for Allu Arjun starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise', and rapper Honey Singh have reportedly teamed up for a peppy number in Salman Khan's 'Bhaijaan'. "The makers have already recorded the song, and some who have heard it insist that it would be an earworm for the audiences," reports stated.

25.title: Can't believe England haven't learnt from their mistakes: Vaughan
25.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has criticised the English team for repeating mistakes that "happened at Lord's" Test in 2021. "You've got Stuart Broad and James Anderson...bowling to Jasprit Bumrah...They decide to go short with the field spread out...Can't believe they haven't learnt," Vaughan said. Notably, Broad went for 35 runs in an over against Bumrah at Edgbaston on Saturday.

26.title: Old is gold, a match-winner: Sehwag to Harbhajan on his 42nd birthday
26.article_body: Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish Harbhajan Singh on his 42nd birthday on Sunday and wrote, "Old is gold, wishing a match-winner and a guy who tries to keep the atmosphere jovial everywhere he goes." Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "Happy Birthday Bhajji pa! You may be done with bowling, but you can never be done with entertaining! Keep shining brother."

27.title: Virat Kohli sledges Jonny Bairstow, makes fun of him; video goes viral
27.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli was seen indulging in a verbal argument with England's Jonny Bairstow during the third day of the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. In a video that has gone viral, Kohli was heard saying, "Little bit faster than Southee...eh?" While, in another video, he was seen making fun of Bairstow after he missed a delivery.

28.title: IndiGo flights hit by delays across India over staff shortage, DGCA seeks clarification
28.article_body: IndiGo flight operations have been hit with massive delays across India due to the non-availability of crew members, reports said on Sunday. Aviation regulator DGCA has taken cognisance of the issue and sought a clarification/explanation from the airline, ANI reported citing DGCA officials. As many as 900 IndiGo flights have been affected due to staff shortage, ET Now reported.

29.title: India coach job for me was to prove media wrong: Shastri
29.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that his coaching job with the Indian team for him was to prove the "media wrong". "The last thing I was worried about was media...The fact was that we were bullies at home and we didn't play great [overseas]. So my job...was to prove media wrong," Shastri said.

30.title: Incoming deliveries were bowled as part of strategy against Root: Zaheer
30.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Zaheer Khan praised Indian pacers for planning England batter Joe Root's wicket on Day 2 of their ongoing rescheduled Test. "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami had a discussion...After that, incoming deliveries were bowled as part of the strategy," stated Zaheer. Mohammed Siraj dismissed Root for 31 with an incoming delivery that had some extra bounce.

31.title: Terrorism is raging because of Congress party: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
31.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said that terrorism is raging because of the Congress party. "In Udaipur, there was recently a killing in broad daylight. We will crush terrorism. We will run bulldozers over the miscreants," Chouhan added. Furthermore, Chouhan said that Congress is a party of "polarisation" and the country lost its respect under their rule.

32.title: PM Modi, Shah’s decision to make me CM opened eyes of many: Eknath Shinde
32.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the decision of PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah to make him the Chief Minister despite having more members than his side "has opened the eyes of many". "Everyone knows that Devendra Fadnavis had 115 members with him. I had only 50," he added.

33.title: What I saw was bizarre, something I never imagined: Shastri on Bumrah's world record
33.article_body: Talking about Jasprit Bumrah breaking the world record for scoring most runs in an over in Tests, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "What I saw was bizarre." He added, "It’s something I’ve never imagined. The world record, from Bumrah, batting at number 10, as captain of India, for the first time." Bumrah scored 29 runs off Stuart Broad's over.

34.title: Twitter CEO takes coffee orders from staff during visit to UK office, pics surface
34.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal visited the company's office in the United Kingdom last week for a series of events. Employees took to Twitter to share photos of Agrawal taking coffee orders while another top Twitter executive, CFO Ned Segal served cookies along with it to the staff. The Managing Director of Twitter UK could also be seen with Agrawal.

35.title: Paris airport workers warn of another walkout from July 8 to 10
35.article_body: Paris airport workers, who have staged a series of strikes demanding higher salaries, have warned of another walkout from July 8-10, which can cause disruption for travellers. Earlier, airport operator ADP offered a 4% pay hike to the staff if they ended the ongoing strike. However, the workers rejected it saying it was not good enough.

36.title: Will test bullet that killed Al Jazeera reporter in West Bank: Israel
36.article_body: Israel said on Sunday that it'll test the bullet that killed a Palestinian-American journalist in May to determine whether one of its soldiers shot her. This comes after Palestine handed over the bullet to US experts after being reassured that Israel won't participate in ballistics test. The victim, Shireen Abu Akleh, was killed while covering a raid in West Bank.

37.title: Adele stops London concert midway to help fans, video viral
37.article_body: British singer Adele, who recently performed at London's BST Hyde Park Festival, stopped her performance four times to help fans. A viral video shows the singer asking the band to stop, walking to the front of the stage and directing security to the fans who needed help. This comes after 10 fans died during Travis Scott's Astroworld Festival in November.

38.title: Broad will always remember two names: Aakash on 35-run over in 5th Test
38.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said England's Stuart Broad will always remember two Indian players, Yuvraj Singh and Jasprit Bumrah. "Broad has created records which he won't be very proud of," added Chopra. Bumrah smashed Broad for the most expensive over in Test cricket history in the ongoing fifth Test, while Yuvraj had smashed him for six consecutive sixes in 2007.

39.title: Rebel MLAs were unable to look us in the eye: Aaditya Thackeray
39.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said that rebel MLAs, who returned to Mumbai from Goa, were unable to look Shiv Sena in the eye. "How long are you going to move from one hotel to the other? These MLAs will have to go to their Assembly constituencies one day. How will they face the people then?" he asked.

40.title: New York bans guns in many public places after Supreme Court order
40.article_body: The US' New York state has banned carrying guns in several public places, including Times Square. Under the new law, gun-licence seekers will be required to prove their shooting skills and submit their social media accounts for review by the government. This comes days after the US Supreme Court ruled against New York's restrictive gun-licence laws.

41.title: Next 30-40 years to be era of BJP: Union Home Minister Amit Shah
41.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah said that the next 30-40 years will be the era of his party and India will become a “vishwa guru” (world leader). Furthermore, Shah, during the BJP's national executive meeting, said “dynastic politics, casteism and politics of appeasement” were the “greatest sins” and the reasons behind the country’s sufferings over the years.

42.title: Delhi Police bust fake call centre cheating US citizens, 12 held
42.article_body: Delhi Police busted a fake call centre involved in cheating US citizens on the pretext of redeeming gift cards and arrested 12 people. "On pointing out of informer a raid was conducted and it was found that a setup of computers and accessories were installed in the premises," said a police release. They presented themselves as Amazon representatives, it added.

43.title: Israel shoots down 3 Hezbollah drones heading towards gas field
43.article_body: The Israeli military said on Saturday that it had shot down three drones launched by the militant group Hezbollah. The Iran-backed Shi'ite group said in a statement that it had launched the unarmed drones towards the "disputed" Karish gas field for reconnaissance missions. "The message was delivered," Hezbollah added. One drone was intercepted by an Israeli fighter jet, AFP reported.

44.title: New sleeping pod hotel opens at Mumbai's CSMT station, pics released
44.article_body: Union Minister of Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday shared photos of the newly-opened sleeping pod hotel at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) in Mumbai. This is the second such facility of the Indian Railways in Mumbai. The new hotel is expected to have a capacity of 50 people along with amenities like key card access, air conditioning, and CCTV surveillance.

45.title: Robbers steal computers from Odisha school, scrawl 'Dhoom 4' on blackboard
45.article_body: Miscreants robbed computers and other electronic items from a high school in Odisha's Nabarangpur district and scrawled phrases like "Dhoom 4", "we will return" and "coming soon" on a blackboard. 'Dhoom 4' is an upcoming Bollywood film, featuring police and thieves. The thieves also allegedly wrote "catch us if you can" in Odia on the blackboard.

46.title: The track was brought to me as a joke: Ishq Bector on Aye Hip Hopper
46.article_body: Rapper-music composer Ishq Bector, speaking about his song 'Aye Hip Hopper', said, "The track came together when Hanif Shaikh brought it to me as a joke about a star hip-hopper and a romantic angle with his maid." "But then it...kind of snowballed," he said, adding, "I presented...demo to Sunidhi Chauhan and she nearly fell off...chair laughing...and agreed to sing [it]."

47.title: Accepting Deputy CM post must be a 'real shocker' for Fadnavis: Shiv Sena
47.article_body: In an editorial of its mouthpiece 'Saamana', Shiv Sena has said that accepting the Deputy CM post must have been a "real shocker" for BJP's Devendra Fadnavis. "...The climax at the Raj Bhavan was the most shocking part...Fadnavis accepted the [Deputy CM] post as the party leadership's order. But now being said...that Fadnavis showed a big heart," the editorial said.

48.title: Tribal woman set ablaze over land dispute in MP, 2 arrested
48.article_body: A tribal woman suffered severe burn injuries after three people set her ablaze over a land dispute in MP's Guna district, police said on Sunday. A video, purportedly shot by the accused, surfaced online, wherein the charred woman was seen crying in pain, with smoke all around her. The police arrested two of the three accused.

49.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
49.article_body: The Health Ministry on Sunday stated that there are 1,11,711 active COVID-19 cases in the country, with Kerala accounting for the highest number of active cases at 29,505. This is followed by Maharashtra (23,447), Tamil Nadu (13,319), West Bengal (9,290), Karnataka (6,440), Telangana (4,784), Gujarat (3,478), Delhi (3,410) and Uttar Pradesh (3,029).

50.title: Great taste my friend: Priyanka to kid who said he 'loves her' in TikTok video
50.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has reacted to a TikTok video where a child could be seen calling her pretty and saying he loves her. She shared the video on her Instagram Stories, writing, "Great taste my friend." The child was reacting to Priyanka's old picture from a 2017 article about her being declared the world's second most beautiful woman after a poll.

51.title: M-cap of 3 of top 10 most valued firms decline by ₹73,630 crore in past week
51.article_body: The market valuation of three of the 10 most valued domestic firms declined by ₹73,630.56 crore in past week. While Reliance Industries took the biggest hit and saw its valuation dipping by ₹62,100.95 crore to reach ₹16,29,684.50 crore. It was followed by ICICI Bank and HUL whose valuation dropped by ₹6,654.2 crore and ₹4,875.41 crore, respectively.

52.title: Is Bihar Police so incompetent?: Tejashwi after BJP tightens office security
52.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticised BJP for increasing security in its party offices in Bihar amid protests against Agnipath scheme and said that they don't have faith in their own "double engine government". "The Bihar government should tell us whether the police is so incompetent so as to warrant deployment of central forces at BJP offices?" asked Yadav.

53.title: 19 dead after bus falls into ravine in Pakistan amid heavy rains
53.article_body: At least 19 people were killed and several others were left injured after a bus veered off a mountainous road amid heavy rains and fell into a ravine in Pakistan's Balochistan province on Sunday. The bus, which was reportedly carrying 30 passengers, was headed from Islamabad towards Quetta. The injured persons have been admitted to hospital, an official said.

54.title: Gadkari shares pics of new 4-lane Goa-Karnataka coastal highway, calls it 'magnificent'
54.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari shared pictures of the new four-lane Goa-Karnataka coastal highway on Twitter. "Magnificent due to its scenic view...this project is an important coastal highway link between west and south India," Gadkari stated. Gadkari added the four-laning of the highway is nearing completion, with 92.42% work already completed. He added the traffic is open on highway.

55.title: 27 missing as ship breaks in half amid typhoon in South China Sea, video surfaces
55.article_body: As many as 27 people are missing and feared dead as a massive ship broke into half and sank amid typhoon Chaba in the South China Sea. A video of the rescue has been released by the Hong Kong Government Flying Service and it shows some crew members being airlifted. The footage shows the offshore vessel partially submerged.

56.title: Kartik is the same person he was before Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success: Kriti
56.article_body: Kartik Aaryan on Saturday shared a video with Kriti Sanon. In the video, the two were promoting his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. When asked if Kartik is the same guy he was before the success of the film, Kriti said Kartik continues to be the same person she knew before. "We don’t let him fly too high," Kriti jokingly added.

57.title: Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani's 'JugJugg Jeeyo' earns ₹100 cr worldwide
57.article_body: Director Raj Mehta's 'JugJugg Jeeyo', which features Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Anil Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor, has earned over ₹100 crore worldwide. The actors took to their respective social media handles to thank fans. As per trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the film has crossed ₹61.44 crore at the Indian box office and is likely to cross ₹65 crore on Sunday.

58.title: 2 boys drown while swimming in artificial farm reservoir in Pune
58.article_body: Two boys, aged 13 and 14, drowned while swimming in an artificial farm reservoir in Pune's Dhayari area on Sunday. A third boy, who didn't get into the reservoir as he didn't know swimming, raised an alarm and called locals for help, a fire officer said. The bodies of the two deceased were recovered, the fire officer added.

59.title: PMC to buy additional saplings worth ₹45 lakh for plantation drive
59.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will purchase additional saplings worth ₹45 lakh for its planned tree plantation drive to increase the green cover in the city, according to officials. PMC Garden Department chief Ashok Ghorpade said that the drive was affected due to the delay in monsoons. "We have saplings at various nurseries, but we'll...purchase additional saplings," he added.

60.title: He is outstanding, a class act: Vaughan after Jadeja's 104-run innings
60.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has praised India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his 104-run innings against England in the ongoing rescheduled Test. "He's a class act. I was looking at his numbers over the last 20-odd Test matches. He's averaging 48, only second to Rohit Sharma," stated Vaughan. Jadeja's hundred helped India post 416 in the first innings.

61.title: 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons spotted near PM's meet venue in Secunderabad
61.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's public meeting in Secunderabad's Parade Grounds on Sunday, 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons were spotted outside the venue. A video of the balloons has also surfaced online. This comes as political banners and posters, including a few inspired by the show 'Money Heist', among others, surfaced across various locations in Hyderabad recently.

62.title: Delhi govt gives 10-day grace period to comply with single-use plastic ban
62.article_body: The Delhi government has decided to be lenient towards those violating the ban on single-use plastic (SUP) items for the initial 10 days. It has launched a campaign to create awareness against the use of such commodities and promote their alternatives. The AAP-led government will also provide incentives to SUP manufacturing units willing to switch over to green alternatives.

63.title: 25-year-old Black man shot 60 times by police in US: Lawyer who watched bodycam footage
63.article_body: A 25-year-old Black man named Jayland Walker was shot over 60 times by police in Ohio after a pursuit over a traffic violation, the lawyer who watched body camera footage of the incident said. The footage will be released to the public on Sunday. The officers involved have been placed on administrative leave during an investigation, the department's statement said.

64.title: Even Kasab didn’t have so much security: Aaditya on protection for rebel Sena MLAs
64.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray reacted to security arrangements for rebel Shiv Sena MLAs and said that even terrorist Ajmal Kasab did not have such security. "We have not seen such security before in Mumbai. Why are you scared? Is someone going to run away?" Thackeray said. The rebel Shiv Sena MLAs reached Vidhan Bhavan in special buses today.

65.title: Italy's Venice becomes world's 1st city to announce entry fee for tourists
65.article_body: Italy's Venice has become the world's first city to announce an entry fee for tourists as it tries to tackle the problem of crowding and "overtourism". The city will charge a €3-€10 (₹247-₹823) entry fee from tourists starting January 16, 2023. Visitors will also have to make an online booking before travelling to Venice next year.

66.title: Rihanna makes first appearance in London after welcoming son
66.article_body: Singer Rihanna made her first public appearance after welcoming her baby boy with rapper A$AP Rocky at the Wireless Festival in London. A$AP Rocky was among the performers at the festival. Rihanna was seen in an all-black ensemble that included a puffer jacket with feathers all around the hoodie and black pants. The couple welcomed their son on May 13.

67.title: BJP made clear democracy is for sale: KC Venugopal on Maha political development
67.article_body: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Congress leader KC Venugopal said that BJP has made it clear that the democracy is for sale. "Anybody can come, take money and they get to join the BJP. This is the fate of democracy in India but the people of India will fight it," Venugopal added.

68.title: I hang my head in 'shame': Kapil Sibal on state of judiciary
68.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal on Sunday expressed concern over the current state of the judiciary, saying that some members of the institution have let us down, adding that he hangs his head in shame. Responding to the arrest of Mohammed Zubair, Sibal said it is "unthinkable" for a person to get arrested for a tweet from four years ago.

69.title: Viral video shows Swiggy delivery boy riding a horse to deliver order amid Mumbai rains
69.article_body: A video of a Swiggy delivery agent riding a horse to deliver an order amid heavy rainfall in Mumbai has gone viral on social media. Several people took to social media to praise the delivery agent for his dedication, with one user saying, "Now this is what I call 'Shahi delivery'." "Something rare to find," said another user.

70.title: Got the tag of Queen of Punjabi films because of Ravii's manifestation: Sargun
70.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta, who was seen in 'Saunkan Saunkne', spoke about her husband Ravii Dubey's role in her success. "I manifested coming in...Punjabi industry with my dreams, but if there’s ever a tag of Queen [of Punjabi films] attached to me, that’ll be Ravii’s manifestation," she said. "Since the time we've been together, that's all he's told me," she added.

71.title: Belarus claims to have intercepted missiles from Ukraine
71.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko claimed that the country intercepted missiles launched by Ukrainian forces a few days ago. Belarus did not want war with Ukraine, but would fight if its territory was invaded, Lukashenko said, according to state media. "They are provoking us…An attempt to strike military facilities on Belarusian territory was made from the territory of Ukraine," he said.

72.title: Mahesh Babu praises Haasan's 'Vikram', calls it 'new-age cult classic'
72.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu took to Twitter to pen a note praising Kamal Haasan's recently released movie 'Vikram'. Calling it a "new-age cult classic", he wrote, "Lokesh Kanagaraj (director), would love to catch up with you and discuss the entire process of Vikram." He also praised the performances of actors Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Kamal Haasan.

73.title: We're in Wimbledon for a stroll: Venus to reporter asking 'are you in it to win it'
73.article_body: During a press conference at Wimbledon 2022, Venus Williams, who's playing the mixed doubles event alongside Jamie Murray, was asked if the two were "in it to win it" or "for the experience" at the tournament. Jamie Murray responded with a smile saying, "We're better than that, come on." Venus replied sarcastically saying, "We're in it for a stroll."

74.title: Man arrested for killing homeless man in hit-and-run case in Delhi
74.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly killing a homeless man in a hit-and-run accident in Delhi's Outer district. The accused, identified as Ashok (31), allegedly crushed the victim's head after a tyre of the generator, which was attached to his car, ran over the victim, the Mangolpuri Police said. Notably, the unidentified deceased lived on footpaths, police added.

75.title: Man climbs wall, enters CM Mamata's residence in Kolkata late at night; arrested
75.article_body: A massive security breach took place at the residence of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee in Kolkata's Kalighat on Saturday late night, after a man allegedly entered its premises by crossing over a wall. The man remained on the premises throughout the night and was arrested by police personnel, who spotted him on Sunday morning, officers said.

76.title: Amber calls $10mn awarded to Johnny 'excessive' in new appeal to dismiss verdict
76.article_body: Amber Heard has filed a fresh court appeal to either dismiss the June defamation trial verdict won by her ex-husband Johnny Depp, or start a new trial. The filing called the $10.35 million awarded to Depp "excessive", saying there was "no evidence" to substantiate it. She also cited 'poor legal reasoning' and 'improperly vetted jury' as reasons for verdict's dismissal.

77.title: Jadeja reminds Anderson of 2014 spat after 'He can bat like a proper batter now' remark
77.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja reacted to England fast bowler James Anderson's remark that he can now bat like a proper batter following his century in the Edgbaston Test. "It's nice Jimmy Anderson has realised that after 2014...so I'm happy," Jadeja said. Notably, Anderson had allegedly abused and pushed Jadeja during the first Test at Trent Bridge in 2014.

78.title: Activists, Oppn protest new Maha govt's car shed plan in Mumbai's Aarey
78.article_body: Climate activists and the Opposition called for a peaceful protest at Mumbai's Aarey forest on Sunday morning, following which hundreds of citizens gathered at the spot. This comes after the newly-formed state government's decision to relocate Metro 3 car shed to Aarey Milk colony. "I humbly urge the new government to reconsider its decision," former minister Aaditya Thackeray tweeted.

79.title: Milind makes music video comeback after 25 yrs, says 'It was super fun'
79.article_body: Actor-model Milind Soman has made a comeback in a music video titled 'Shringaar'. Sharing his experience, Milind said it was "super fun" to do a music video after 25 years. "When 'Shringaar' came my way, I instantly loved...[it] and wanted to be...part of it," he added. Composed by Vayu, the song has been sung by Akasa, Aastha Gill and Raftaar.

80.title: BJP-Sena govt has taken charge, based on beliefs of Balasaheb Thackeray: Shinde
80.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the BJP-Shiv Sena government has taken charge, based on the beliefs of Balasaheb Thackeray. "I myself was a minister, several other ministers too left the government. This was a huge thing for a common worker like me who was devoted to the ideology of Balasaheb Thackeray and Anand Dighe," he added.

81.title: Headmaster accused of secretly filming female teachers hits them with stones in UP
81.article_body: A headmaster in UP's Bareilly has been suspended after a video of him attacking female teachers with stones went viral on social media. Khurshid Ali has been accused of secretly filming teachers, who he claims were working on their laptops rather than teaching children. Police said that a probe has been initiated against Ali in connection with the incident.

82.title: Punjab National Bank hikes FD interest rates on selected tenors from July 4
82.article_body: Punjab National Bank has increased interest rates on fixed deposits below ₹2 crore. Effective from July 4, it has increased rates on deposits with a maturity of 1-2 years and up to 3 years by 10 to 20 basis points. Deposits of 1-2 years will fetch a 5.30% interest rate, up by 10 basis points from 5.20%.

83.title: Always put Aus cricket in front; IPL, BBL taken backseat: Starc
83.article_body: Australian pacer Mitchell Starc has said that he always puts Australian cricket "in front" and for that, IPL and BBL have taken a "backseat". "I will always keep Australian cricket...and then franchise cricket...I have looked at the Australian schedule and want to be as fit and well-performed for that," Starc said after opting out of the upcoming BBL season.

84.title: We've often seen a partnership after England's 5th wicket falls: Jaffer
84.article_body: After England ended Day 2 of fifth Test against India at 84/5 in Edgbaston, Wasim Jaffer said a partnership has often been seen following the fall of hosts' fifth wicket. "India will have to stop that in...morning. This partnership between Jonny Bairstow and Ben Stokes is very important. If these wickets fall quickly, India will be in control," he added.

85.title: 3 Hyd metro stations to be closed during PM Modi's public meeting
85.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's public meeting in Secunderabad on Sunday, metro stations of Paradise, Parade Grounds and JBS will be closed between 5:30 pm and 8 pm. Trains won't halt at these stations during this duration amid security concerns, Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited announced. Trains plying on Corridor 2 will ply between Secunderabad West and MGBS during this time.

86.title: Kohli might be praying for such clarity: Manjrekar on Jadeja's knock vs Eng
86.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said Virat Kohli might be praying to have the same clarity that Ravindra Jadeja had in his 104-run innings against England in the ongoing Test. "Jadeja was leaving the balls even slightly outside the off-stump, was playing them when it was close to off-stump and driving the pitched-up deliveries," explained Manjrekar. Kohli got out for 11(19).

87.title: Lower Byrasandra lake restoration to be over by next month: BBMP official
87.article_body: Restoration work being carried out at Bengaluru's Lower Byrasandra lake, also known as the Kelagina Kere, will get over by the next month, a BBMP executive engineer (lakes department) said. The civic body started the restoration work last year. An activist said that BBMP should also "concentrate" on Upper Byrasandra lake, which is about 200 metre from Lower Byrasandra lake.

88.title: Man promises to sell gold at inexpensive price, cheats 20 persons of ₹75 lakh in MP
88.article_body: A man from West Bengal allegedly cheated over 20 persons in MP on promise of selling them gold at an inexpensive price. The accused collected over ₹75 lakh from the victims, according to police. He had an office, that remains closed now, in MP Nagar from where he ran his business. According to police, efforts are underway to nab him.

89.title: China renews yellow alert as rainstorms hit some regions
89.article_body: China renewed a yellow alert on Sunday as severe rainstorms struck some parts of the country. The weather department has predicted rainstorms in parts of Guangdong, Guangxi, Hunan and Hubei regions. It has advised local governments to prepare for the heavy downpour and to check the drainage systems. It has also suggested authorities to take appropriate traffic control measures.

90.title: Akhilesh dissolves all SP executive units, except party's UP chief post
90.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav has dissolved all of the party's national, state and district executive bodies, except its Uttar Pradesh President post, with immediate effect. "National presidents, state presidents, district presidents of all...party's organisations, including youth and women's wings, have also been dissolved," SP tweeted. However, SP didn't give any reason for the move.

91.title: Only our party can free Delhi from BJP's garbage mountains: AAP MLA
91.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's MLA and MCD in-charge Durgesh Pathak urged Delhi Governor to conduct Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections immediately and said that only AAP party can bring freedom from the "BJP’s garbage mountains" in the national capital. "From whichever side one enters Delhi...you are welcomed by the BJP's heaps of trash that are scattered all over," Pathak said.

92.title: Real face of democracy under BJP: Khalsa Aid Founder on his Twitter account ban
92.article_body: Khalsa Aid Founder Ravi Singh criticised the central government after his Twitter account was banned in India on Saturday. Sharing a picture of the account on Facebook, Singh wrote, "My Twitter account has been banned in India! This is the real face of democracy under the BJP!! Banning Sikh social media accounts won't stop us raising our voices!"

93.title: Bairstow looks like a shadow of the player who scored vs NZ: Swann
93.article_body: Talking about England batter Jonny Bairstow, who remained unbeaten at 12(47) at the end of Day 2 against India, ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said the 32-year-old is looking like a "shadow of the player who was smashing it against New Zealand last week". Swann added, "Bairstow wasn't facing bowling of this standard." England ended Day 2 at 84/5.

94.title: Meta to shut down cryptocurrency wallet pilot Novi on September 1
94.article_body: Meta is shutting down the pilot service of its cryptocurrency digital wallet Novi on September 1. On Novi's website, Meta asked users to withdraw their balance "as soon as possible" and that users won't be able to access their transaction history or other data after the pilot ends. Novi pilot was launched in October 2021 for users in the US.

95.title: Remember Akram being angry on Razzaq: Kaif recalls Ind-Pak 2003 WC match
95.article_body: Former India batter Mohammad Kaif recalled an incident from the India-Pakistan match at the 2003 World Cup. "If [Abdul] Razzaq had taken [Sachin] Tendulkar's catch at mid-off, the match could have been very tight," Kaif said. "I remember Wasim Akram being angry at him...[as] Razzaq was literally standing next to the bowler instead of proper mid-off," Kaif added.

96.title: Centre to develop urban forests in 6 Jharkhand cities
96.article_body: Six cities of Jharkhand have been chosen for the Centre's 'Nagar Van' or urban forest scheme. The six cities are namely Ranchi, Bokaro, Dhanbad, Hazaribag, Jamshedpur and Giridih. A total of 75 cities have been chosen across India for the scheme, which will be launched on July 9 with 75 saplings being planted in each urban forest, an official said.

97.title: Assamese actor Kishor Das passes away aged 30 after battling cancer for over a year
97.article_body: Popular Assamese actor Kishor Das passed away aged 30 in Chennai after battling cancer for over a year. Kishor, who hailed from Mirza, was also suffering from COVID-19 complications at the time of his death. As per a report, his last rites were performed in Chennai as his mortal remains couldn't be brought to hometown due to coronavirus pandemic protocols.

98.title: Thousands asked to evacuate as Australia's Sydney braces for floods
98.article_body: Thousands of people were ordered to evacuate in Australia's Sydney as torrential rainfall and winds battered the region. The authorities have warned of heavy rainfall that could lead to flash floods and landslides along the east coast region. "We are now facing dangers on multiple fronts - flash flooding, riverine flooding and coastal erosion," said an official.

99.title: TV anchor falsely claims Rahul Gandhi called Udaipur killers 'children'; FIR filed
99.article_body: An FIR has been filed against TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and others for allegedly misrepresenting Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the vandalisation of his office in Kerala as his statement on Udaipur killing. Rahul called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but his comments were aired as remarks on Udaipur murder accused.

100.title: He was good friends with accused, knew him since 2006: Brother of killed Amravati chemist
100.article_body: Mahesh Kolhe, the brother of Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe who was killed over his post supporting ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma, said that his brother was good friends with Yusuf Khan (arrested accused), a practicing veterinarian. Mahesh Kolhe added, "We knew him since 2006." Seven accused, including alleged mastermind Shaikh Irfan Shaikh Rahim, have been arrested in the case so far.

101.title: Guv says blasts killed 3 in Russian city; lawmaker blames Ukraine
101.article_body: At least three people were killed and 50 buildings were damaged due to blasts in Russian city of Belgorod, which is located near Ukraine border, the regional Governor said on Sunday. Russian lawmaker Andrey Klishas claimed that the blasts were a "direct act of aggression on the part of Ukraine". Klishas also called for a "severe" response to the incident.

102.title: 18-yr-old Odisha student dies by suicide in college hostel, alleges ragging
102.article_body: An 18-year-old girl pursuing BA (Honours) History in Odisha's college allegedly died by suicide in her hostel room alleging ragging and torture by her seniors. The girl stayed back in her room and locked it from inside when her roommates left to attend classes at around 10 am, hostel's superintendent said. The girl's mother urged the police to find culprits.

103.title: Need development but not at cost of environment: Amit Thackeray on Aarey shed plan
103.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s son Amit Thackeray called Eknath Shinde-led government’s move to build the metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey colony, "shocking". "We definitely need development but not at the cost of environment," Amit said. "If our environment is completely destroyed then there will be no one left for politics or to be ruled upon," he added.

104.title: Delhi govt's finance dept seeks list of officers for early retirement
104.article_body: The Delhi government's finance department has directed all of its departments to provide a list of officers who can be considered for premature retirement. The officers who are nearing retirement age and are found to be ineffective are likely to be included in that list, officials said. The departmental heads have been asked to treat the matter as "most urgent".

105.title: Will distribute 21,000 acres land I freed from mafias to poor: MP CM
105.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that he has freed 21,000 acres of land from clutches of mafias in the state and  announced that he will distribute these lands among poor. "Some influential people encroach upon acres of land due to their muscle power and rowdyism. They should know that Shivraj Singh Chouhan will not spare them," he added.

106.title: Hand grenade thrown at religious school in Afghanistan; 8 injured
106.article_body: At least eight people were injured after a hand grenade was thrown at a religious school in Afghanistan's Nangarhar province on Saturday, Xinhua reported citing local media. This came as a meeting of religious scholars and elders in Kabul was set to conclude the same day. All the injured people were taken to a hospital, a police spokesperson said.

107.title: Test cricket seems very easy for Jasprit Bumrah: Ajit Agarkar
107.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajit Agarkar has praised India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah for his performance in the ongoing Test against England. "Bowl well, get wickets, get runs, become captain, and put India in a terrific position...Test cricket seems very easy [for Bumrah]," stated Agarkar. Bumrah scored 31*(16) in the first innings and has picked three wickets so far in the match.

108.title: BJP will win in Telangana Assembly polls next year: Keshav Maurya
108.article_body: On his visit to Hyderabad, Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Keshav Prasad Maurya said that BJP will win the next year's Telangana Assembly elections. "Today I took [the] blessing of Mata Bhagyalaxmi here (Hyderabad) at Charminar. I request Telangana people to visit devotional places in Uttar Pradesh. We will come to power," Maurya said.

109.title: Actress Mahhi Vij's cook arrested for threatening to kill her and her family with 'khanjar'
109.article_body: Actress Mahhi Vij's cook has been arrested for allegedly threatening to kill her and her family with 'khanjar' (dagger). As per the police, the cook had issued death threats following a salary dispute. Mahhi had also stated that the cook had hurled abuses at her family and also added that he was stealing from them.

110.title: Ola Electric sees 32 high-level exits in 2 years as Head of Charging Network resigns
110.article_body: The Senior Director and Business Head of Charging Network at Ola Electric Mobility has resigned from the company after joining in March 2021. Yashwant Kumar's exit comes days after the resignation of Ranjit Kondeshan who was the HR Director at Ola Electric. According to ET Auto, this is the 32nd high-level exit from the company in the last two years.

111.title: Grateful to Thor team's imagination to cast 5'3" actress in 6-ft role: Natalie
111.article_body: Natalie Portman, who'll be seen as The Mighty Thor in 'Thor: Love and Thunder', said that she's grateful to everyone's imagination to cast a five-three actress in a six-foot role. "That takes a real leap of possibility in your mind and probably not something I'll, you know, get...opportunity to do, to be imagined as, by any other group," she added.

112.title: I have to say I was wrong: Nadal on calling opponent to net in middle of match
112.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal has apologised for calling Lorenzo Sonego to the net in the middle of their third-round match at Wimbledon. Nadal reportedly had an exchange over Sonego's 'loud grunts' during points. "I have to say I was wrong. I shouldn't (have) called him to the net," stated Nadal, who won with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-2, 6-4.

113.title: Preity shares pic with Hrithik, Sussanne, Sonali; says 'A night to remember'
113.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share a picture showing her posing with Hrithik Roshan, Sussanne Khan, Arslan Goni, Sonali Bendre and Gene Goodenough. "A night to remember #memories," she captioned the picture. Reacting to Preity's post, a fan wrote, "90s kids would love it." Preity and Hrithik worked together in several movies, including 'Mission Kashmir' and 'Lakshya'.

114.title: 2 teenagers killed, 1 man wounded in shooting in US' Texas
114.article_body: Two teenage boys were killed and a 20-year-old man was wounded in a shooting that took place at a Houston-area apartment complex in US' Texas, said authorities. While the teenagers were declared dead at a hospital, the injured victim is expected to survive. An official said the confrontation may have started at a pool party.

115.title: I'm really looking forward to Saif's performance in Vikram Vedha: Madhavan
115.article_body: R Madhavan, who played the role of Vikram in Tamil film 'Vikram Vedha', spoke about the film's upcoming remake which stars Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan. He said that he's looking forward to Saif's performance as Vikram in the film. "I want to know whether he'll beat me, and make it more convincing because I've...feeling he will," Madhavan said.

116.title: Our best line of defence is attack; Eng batters are aggressive: Anderson
116.article_body: After England's score being at 84/5 at stumps on Day two of the fifth Test, pacer James Anderson feels that the team's "best line of defence" on Sunday will be to attack. "The way we've got out of sticky situations is trying to put pressure back on the opposition...Our batters are naturally aggressive...We've been in this position before," Anderson said.

117.title: Udaipur district administration relaxes curfew from 8 am to 6 pm today
117.article_body: Udaipur's district administration has decided to relax the curfew for 10 hours today, District Magistrate Tara Chand Meena said. The curfew will be relaxed from 8 am to 6 pm, the District Magistrate added. The curfew had been imposed on June 28 in the district after the beheading of a tailor for supporting suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma.

118.title: Will miss Aarey protest, have to attend Assembly session: Aaditya
118.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said he would miss the protest for Aarey forest as he has to attend the State Assembly session. He urged the newly-formed CM Eknath Shinde-led government to reconsider its decision to build the metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey colony. "Don't cast the hate for us on to our beloved Mumbai," he tweeted.

119.title: BJP's Rahul Narwekar to be the new Maharashtra Assembly Speaker
119.article_body: First-time Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Rahul Narwekar will be the new Maharashtra Assembly Speaker. He won 164 votes, while 144 is the halfway mark. An advocate by profession, Narwekar, who had been associated with the Shiv Sena as well as the NCP in the past, joined the BJP in the run-up to the October 2019 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

120.title: 2 armed LeT terrorists caught by villagers in J&K; ₹7 lakh reward announced for them
120.article_body: Two armed Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists, Faizal Ahmed Dar and Talib Hussain, were overpowered and handed over to the police by villagers in Jammu and Kashmir's Reasi district on Sunday. Two AK assault rifles, seven grenades and a pistol were recovered from them, officials said. A reward of ₹7 lakh was announced for the villagers by the Lieutenant Governor and DGP.

121.title: Non-inclusive approach an invitation to disaster: CJI NV Ramana
121.article_body: CJI NV Ramana on Saturday said that in the 21st century, we cannot allow petty, narrow and divisive issues to dictate human and societal relationships. "We have to rise above all the divisive issues to remain focused on human development. A non-inclusive approach is an invitation to disaster," CJI added.

122.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states until July 7, list released
122.article_body: IMD has issued heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs amid monsoon until July 7. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Gujarat, Goa, Karnataka and Kerala. It's likely over Maharashtra from July 4 to 7, and over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from July 5 to 7. Heavy rainfall is also very likely over Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh in next few days.

123.title: Totally false: Cong on report of Rahul seeking AIADMK's support for Prez election
123.article_body: Congress refuted a report which claimed that Rahul Gandhi called up AIADMK's Edappadi K Palaniswami to seek support for Opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha. "This is wholly bogus and totally false. No such phone call was made. The DMK-Congress alliance is firm and steadfast enough to withstand such crude and mischievous efforts to sow confusion and weaken it," Congress said.

124.title: Biden asks oil firms to lower prices amid 'war & global peril', Bezos responds
124.article_body: The world's second-richest person Jeff Bezos responded to a tweet by US President Joe Biden, who asked oil companies to lower their prices amid "war and global peril". Bezos wrote, "Ouch. Inflation is far too important a problem for the White House to keep making statements like this. It's either straight ahead misdirection or a...misunderstanding of basic market dynamics."

125.title: Scrapping Article 377 hasn't helped LGBTQ in smaller cities: Sarathi Trust
125.article_body: Nagpur-based Sarathi Trust Founder Anand Chandrani said that even after Article 377 has been scrapped, the LGBTQIA+ community still faces discrimination in society predominantly in smaller cities. "When we organise private get-togethers in Nagpur, around 300-400 people come, but when it comes to Pride marches or any public events, you will find only 80-100 people," he added.

126.title: Cong leader says 'Deve Gowda will soon be carried by 4'; apologises
126.article_body: Following criticism, Congress leader KN Rajanna has apologised for his remarks on former PM HD Deve Gowda in which he apparently suggested that the latter's end was near, saying, "I regret if my words have hurt him, his family or well-wishers...I apologise." Earlier, Rajanna said, "Deve Gowda is presently being carried by two people. Soon, four people will carry him."

127.title: RRR finishes 2nd at H'wood Critics Association Awards; beats Top Gun 2, Batman
127.article_body: Ram Charan and Jr NTR starrer 'RRR' finished runner-up in the Best Picture category at the Hollywood Critics Association Midseason Awards, beating movies such as 'The Batman' and 'Top Gun: Maverick'. The award for Best Picture went to Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's adventure comedy 'Everything Everywhere All At Once'. 'RRR' was directed by SS Rajamouli.

128.title: Don't want to be known as a drunkard who crashes his car: Madhavan
128.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, on being asked how he maintains the image of a complete family man along with doing good work, said, "I don't want to be known as a drunkard who crashes his car." "I am a really shy person," he added. "I've only restricted myself to Amitabh Bachchan's Diwali party and Shah Rukh's (Khan) birthday party," said Madhavan.

129.title: Insulted institution of both CM, PM: Union Minister as T'gana CM skips welcoming PM
129.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped PM Narendra Modi’s welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport on Saturday, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "Telangana CM has insulted the institution of both CM and PM". "CM KCR can hide but his corrupt politics will not remain hidden," Pradhan added. "Cooperative federalism in letter and spirit is cornerstone of our democracy," he stated.

130.title: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction seals legislative party office
130.article_body: Ahead of the special session in Maharashtra Assembly to elect the Speaker, rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led faction sealed the legislative party office in the Vidhan Bhavan. The rebel MLAs have arrived at the Vidhan Sabha after leaving Hotel Trident in Mumbai. BJP MLAs, including Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis, have also arrived.

131.title: Amazon delivery agent saves girl after metal piece pierces her cheek at school in Thane
131.article_body: An Amazon delivery agent helped in saving a child after a part of a metal gate pierced through her cheek while she was playing in her school in Thane. Until help arrived, the agent held onto the metal gate for 30 minutes to ensure it would not injure the girl any further. The incident was shared online by a resident.

132.title: Not sure how I bullied him: Kyrgios after Tsitsipas calls him 'evil bully' after match
132.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas called Nick Kyrgios a "bully" after he lost the third-round match 7-6(7-2), 4-6, 3-6, 6-7(7-9) against the Australian in the ongoing Wimbledon 2022. "Kyrgios bullies opponents. He was probably a bully at school. I don't like bullies," Tsitsipas had said after the match. "I'm not sure how I bullied him...I did nothing disrespectful," replied Kyrgios.

133.title: Zee News anchor falsely claims Rahul Gandhi called Udaipur killers 'children'; FIR filed
133.article_body: An FIR has been filed against Zee News anchor Rohit Ranjan, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and others for allegedly misrepresenting Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the vandalisation of his office in Kerala as his statement on Udaipur killing. Rahul called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but the channel aired his comment as remarks on Udaipur murder accused.

134.title: Rare transparent fish found in Alaska, pic surfaces
134.article_body: Deep-sea scientists have discovered a rare transparent fish during a routine survey in Alaska. Sharing a picture, Sarah Friedman, a fish biologist at National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), tweeted, "Been hoping to see one of these in person for a long time! Blotched snailfish (Crystallichthys cyclospilus)." The blotched snailfish camouflage themselves to be invisible to predators.

135.title: Important to follow right footsteps: Aaditya in 1st Insta post after govt collapse
135.article_body: Former Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray posted for the first time on Instagram after the fall of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government and shared a picture of him walking behind father Uddhav Thackeray. His post read, "Always important to follow the right footsteps. Indebted to all for your love and blessings that keep coming our way, that is our true strength."

136.title: Fire breaks out in train's engine in Bihar; all passengers safe
136.article_body: A fire broke out in the engine of a DMU train near the Bhelwa railway station in Bihar on Sunday. While the cause of the blaze is yet to be ascertained, all the passengers aboard the train were evacuated and are safe as the fire didn't spread. A video of the fire shows the engine in flames and smoke billowing.

137.title: Bajrang Dal, VHP members summoned over Gurugram protest after FIR
137.article_body: Gurugram Police summoned Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) members a day after booking them for allegedly raising abusive slogans during a protest demanding action over the Udaipur killing. "No arrests have been made so far. The probe is underway," said police. The protesters, in purported videos, were heard shouting, "Desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaro..."

138.title: RPF seized narcotics worth over ₹7.40 cr last month: Railway Ministry
138.article_body: Railway Protection Force (RPF) seized narcotics worth over ₹7.40 crore and arrested 165 persons who were carrying NDPS under Operation "NARCOS" in June 2022, the Railway Ministry said. "RPF intensified its checks in trains and identified black spots across the country in coordination with NCB and other LEA's to target drug peddlers," the Railway Ministry said in its release.

139.title: Delhi Police busts illicit liquor factory; 1 arrested
139.article_body: Delhi Police busted an illicit liquor factory in New Usmanpur and arrested one person. A police team, while patrolling the area, sensed a foul smell similar to liquor, after which they searched a nearby house. They recovered a plastic drum containing approximately 220 litres of illicit liquor, 50 sealed quarter bottles and plastic containers containing chemicals, among other materials.

140.title: India records 16,103 new COVID-19 cases, 31 deaths in last 24 hours
140.article_body: India has reported 16,103 new COVID-19 cases, 13,929 recoveries and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload currently stands at 1,11,711, while the daily positivity rate has reached 4.27%. The country's COVID-19 death toll has reached 5,25,199.

141.title: Will behead myself if I've done anything wrong: Karnataka HC Judge
141.article_body: Karnataka High Court Judge Justice B Veerappa has said that he is "upset" over advocates making false and baseless charges against judges and urged them to stay away from this. "If I've done anything wrong, I'm ready to stand between Vidhana Soudha and High Court and behead myself," he added. Veerappa was speaking at an Advocates Association Bengaluru (AAB) event.

142.title: Is Zak Crawley comfortable being this 'inconsistent talent': Nasser
142.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said England opener Zak Crawley needs to think if he's comfortable being "this inconsistent talent" in Test cricket. "It's the repetitive nature of dismissals that [will] eventually, become a concern," added Nasser. Crawley was dismissed for 9(17) in the ongoing Test against India, which was his ninth single-figure score in his last 11 Test innings.

143.title: MP sarpanch raises anti-national slogans after poll win; probe on
143.article_body: The police have launched a probe after a video showing a sarpanch in Madhya Pradesh's Katni village allegedly raising anti-national slogans along with his supporters after winning local elections went viral. In the video, the sarpanch and his supporters were purportedly heard raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans. "We have registered [a] case in the matter," a police official said.

144.title: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi's ex-husband Athar Aamir Khan gets engaged, shares pic
144.article_body: IAS 2015 rank 2 and Srinagar Municipal Corporation (SMC) Commissioner Athar Aamir Khan, who got divorced with IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi last year, got engaged to Mehreen, who is a doctor. Athar took to Instagram to share a picture with Mehreen. In April this year, Tina got married to Dr Pradeep Gawande, a 2013-batch IAS officer.

145.title: Sad to lose my record, suffered for 19 yrs, jokes Peterson on Broad's most expensive over
145.article_body: Ex-South Africa spinner Robin Peterson reacted to England's Stuart Broad bowling the costliest over in Test history. Peterson jokingly wrote, "Sad to lose my record today...Oh well...records are made to be broken I guess." Peterson jokingly added he suffered for 19 years. Peterson jointly held the previous record after he was hit for 28 runs by Brian Lara in 2003.

146.title: Nitish Kumar is NDA and NDA is Nitish Kumar in Bihar: JD(U)'s Upendra Kushwaha
146.article_body: JD(U)’s Upendra Kushwaha said, "Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is NDA and NDA is Nitish Kumar in Bihar". "He's been leading the coalition since it came into being...He will continue to do so as long as NDA exists in Bihar," Kushwaha added. His statement came days after Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said Kumar will complete his current term as Bihar CM.

147.title: Will discuss it at appropriate platform: Law Minister Rijiju on SC's remarks on Nupur
147.article_body: After the Supreme Court criticised former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said he will discuss the issue at an appropriate platform. "Even if I don't like the judgement or I have serious objection to the manner in which the observations are made, I would not like to comment," he said.

148.title: Varun in talks with Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 director Anees for comedy film: Report
148.article_body: Varun Dhawan is in conversations with 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee for a comedy film, according to a report. "If all goes as planned, the comic caper will go on floors by next year-end," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. Varun, who was most recently seen in 'JugJugg Jeeyo', will next be seen in the horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'.

149.title: Man sarcastically says he has 'bomb' in his luggage at Cochin airport; arrested
149.article_body: A 63-year-old man and his wife were denied boarding at the Cochin International Airport on Saturday after the man sarcastically remarked that his bag had a "bomb" when asked about the contents of his luggage. As per the police, the man did not like the extensive security checking at the airport. He was arrested and later released on bail.

150.title: 100-year-old British-era passport revived by Pune-based institute
150.article_body: A 100-year-old passport issued by the British government to Bhaskar Gangadhar Kelkar, an MBBS graduate looking to go to London for higher studies, was restored by the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) in Pune. According to BORI Chairman Bhupal Patwardhan, the life of the passport, which was issued in August 1921, has been enhanced to last 60 more years.

151.title: Four teens arrested for stealing jewellery worth ₹2 lakh from Mumbai temple
151.article_body: Four teenagers were arrested for allegedly stealing ornaments worth ₹2 lakh from the Kalimata Temple at Anand Nagar in Dahisar East, Mumbai. The accused were arrested after a resident reported the theft of a gold necklace and gold bangles from the idol, police said. Notably, two of the accused are 19 years old, while the remaining two are minors.

152.title: Mumbai man gets 1-month jail for holding cousin's hand, proposing marriage
152.article_body: A 43-year-old Mumbai-based man was awarded one month imprisonment by Mulund court for holding his young cousin's hand 13 years ago and asking her to marry him. A man has no right to touch a woman's body without her permission, even if he is her relative, the court stated. The minor had lodged a complaint on February 2, 2009.

153.title: AAP members to send ₹420 cheques to PM in protest against 'Agnipath': Sanjay Singh
153.article_body: AAP members will send cheques and demand drafts (DDs) for ₹420 to PM Narendra Modi in a symbolic protest against the 'Agnipath' scheme, AAP's Sanjay Singh said. He added, PM would be told not to do "char sau bisi (cheating)" with the Indian Army and the party would appeal to government “to not cry for money to protect the country.”

154.title: One of the key accused in 2002 Godhra train coach burning case gets life term
154.article_body: Godhra sessions court has awarded the 2002 Godhra train coach burning accused Rafiq Hussain Bhatuk life imprisonment under the conspiracy to murder charge, special public prosecutor RC Kodekar said. Bhatuk was part of the "core group" of accused persons involved in the conspiracy, police said. Absconding for 19 years, he was arrested by Gujarat Police from Godhra town last year.

155.title: Tesla deliveries drop by 18% in Q2 due to COVID-19 shutdown in China
155.article_body: Due to China's COVID-19-related shutdown and its subsequent disruption of the company's production and supply chain, Tesla delivered 17.9% fewer electric vehicles in the second quarter than the previous quarter. Tesla said while June 2022 was the highest vehicle production month in the company's history, the preceding quarter ended a nearly two-year-long run of record quarterly deliveries.

156.title: Pretty unlucky, there were plenty of top edges: Anderson on Broad's 35-run over
156.article_body: England pacer James Anderson has said Stuart Broad was "pretty unlucky" in conceding 35 runs from his 18th over in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against India. "On another day, when the luck was with Stuart, an edge probably would've gone to hand," added Anderson. Bumrah scored 29 runs off the over, while the remaining came off extras.

157.title: Some 'qualitative' changes in him: Pawar on Maha Guv offering sweets to Shinde
157.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar reacted to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari feeding sweets to CM Eknath Shinde during his swearing-in ceremony and said that he has seen some "qualitative changes" in the governor's treatment of public representatives. Koshyari also did not object to Shinde mentioning names of Balasaheb Thackeray, Anand Dighe while taking oath, which he did earlier, Pawar added.

158.title: Lindsay Lohan reveals she is married to Dubai-based financier Shammas, shares pic
158.article_body: Actress Lindsay Lohan took to Instagram to reveal that she tied the knot with Dubai-based financier Bader Shammas. "I'm the luckiest woman in the world...I am stunned that this is my husband. My life and my everything," she wrote. In November last year, Lohan announced her engagement to Shammas. Lohan's representatives confirmed to 'People' that she has tied the knot.

159.title: PMC collects 593 kg of plastics, files 30 cases in 2 days
159.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) collected 593 kg of plastics in two days since the nationwide ban on single-use plastics came into effect. It also filed 30 cases against the violators. "The fines range from ₹5,000, ₹10,000 to ₹25,000. If violation continues after the third penalty, an FIR will be lodged," said an official.

160.title: Bangalore Development Authority officials booked over ₹100 cr land scam
160.article_body: Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) officials were booked on Saturday for allegedly swapping prime land with another parcel of property resulting in a ₹100 crore loss, the agency's Chairman SR Vishwanath said. He added that the officials had colluded with a person named Nagaraj and called it a "mega scam". He also ordered a BDA task force to probe all documents.

161.title: 28-year-old web series actress arrested for biting & manhandling policewoman in Pune
161.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 28-year-old woman, who has acted in a few web series, for allegedly biting and manhandling a policewoman on duty. Police said the actress, currently residing in Andheri, Mumbai, is an original resident of Karnataka. Parvin Shaikh, attached to the Damini Squad of Pune city police, lodged an FIR at Chandan Nagar police station.

162.title: Bumrah takes 3 wickets after setting world record, England trail by 332 runs after Day 2
162.article_body: India captain Jasprit Bumrah took three wickets as England ended the second day of rescheduled fifth Test at 84/5 in their first innings, trailing India by 332 runs. Earlier in the day, Bumrah broke world record for scoring the most runs in an over in a Test (29), helping India post 416/10. James Anderson picked five wickets for England.

163.title: Union Minister Shekhawat useless, absent-minded in meetings: Raj CM
163.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot called Union Minister Gajendra Shekhawat "useless" and said that he remains "absent-minded" during PM Narendra Modi's meetings. He stated, "We'll ask the PM someday why he keeps such a nikamma (useless) minister who remains absent-minded in your meetings." Gehlot's remark was over an alleged denial by Shekhawat about PM Modi's "promise" regarding a canal project.

164.title: 2 kids killed due to wall collapse amid heavy rain in Rajasthan
164.article_body: Two children were killed in a rain-related incident after a wall collapsed on them in Rajasthan's Chhatargarh. The deceased, who were brothers, have been identified as 10-year-old Rakesh Kumar and 8-year-old Anil Kumar, police said. The duo was sleeping in their house when the incident occurred. Heavy rainfall has been recorded in several parts of Rajasthan since Friday.

165.title: State govt will regularise services of pourakarmikas: K'taka CM
165.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said the state government will regularise services of pourakarmikas who work on direct payment. This comes after over 15,000 pourakarmikas went on an indefinite strike from Friday in Bengaluru seeking permanent jobs and better pay. "We've agreed to extend social security, medical services and assistance for education of children of pourakarmikas," he said.

166.title: 5 of a family, including 2 minors, found dead in house in Kerala
166.article_body: Police said that five members of a family, including two minor children, were found dead in their house near Kallambalam in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday morning. "Prima facie it is a suspected case of suicide," a police official said. "As per the indications received, the family was worried about some financial issues," the official added.

167.title: Wanted to play against Serena and Venus in singles at Wimbledon: Sania
167.article_body: On being asked who she would've liked to play against but never got the chance at Wimbledon, ex-women's doubles world number one Sania Mirza said Serena and Venus Williams in singles. "I did play them in doubles but never in singles," she added. Sania, who entered mixed doubles second round at Wimbledon 2022, is competing in her last season.

168.title: 'Vikasvad defeating Parivarvad' under PM Modi's leadership: Nadda
168.article_body: Speaking at BJP national executive meet in Hyderabad, party chief JP Nadda lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said, "Vikasvad is defeating Parivarvad" under PM Modi's leadership, an ANI report said. Dynasty politics is being rejected by people due to politics of development, he added. He lauded PM Modi for the electoral victories of the BJP including UP and Manipur.

169.title: 2 electrocuted by broken live wire in West Bengal's Bankura
169.article_body: Two people were electrocuted in West Bengal's Bankura district on Saturday morning, police said. They said that 62-year-old Parbati Ghosh was electrocuted when she came in contact with a live wire that had broken during overnight thunderstorms and rains. When 58-year-old Ananga Ghosh tried to rescue her, he too was electrocuted, police added.

170.title: World no. 1 Swiatek crashes out of Wimbledon as Cornet ends her 37-match winning streak
170.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek was knocked out of Wimbledon in third round by French tennis player Alizé Cornet. With the defeat, Swiatek's 37-match winning streak came to an end. Swiatek lost the match with a scoreline of 4-6, 2-6. In June, Swiatek had defeated Coco Gauff in the French Open 2022 final to bag her second Roland Garros title.

171.title: Hostellers clash at Guwahati's Cotton University, several injured
171.article_body: Many students were injured in a clash between inmates of two hostels of Cotton University in Guwahati on Saturday, officials said. A group of inmates of a boys hostel allegedly threw bricks and bottles at another hostel around 1.45 am, to which a few students retaliated, officials added. A case was filed and the probe has begun, police said.

172.title: Amravati police chief tried to hide chemist's killing by calling it robbery: MP Navneet
172.article_body: MP Navneet Rana has sought action against Amravati Police Commissioner Aarti Singh over the June 21 killing of chemist Umesh Kolhe who had supported Nupur Sharma. Rana alleged that Singh tried to "suppress the case" by passing it off as a robbery. "After 12 days she's giving clarification on the incident...(An) enquiry must be done against [her]," said Rana.

173.title: The way Bumrah batted reflects team's positive mindset in 5th Test: Zaheer
173.article_body: Reflecting on stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah's 31*(16) in the first innings of fifth India-England Test, Zaheer Khan said, "The way Bumrah batted reflects the team's positive mindset. The momentum is now with India." Bumrah scored 29 runs in an over by Stuart Broad. "It was a hugely entertaining over," Zaheer added. India were bowled out for 416 in first innings.
