174.title: Man who 'masterminded' Amravati chemist's killing for supporting Nupur arrested
174.article_body: The seventh accused in the murder of Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe has been arrested, police said on Saturday. The accused, identified as Shaikh Irfan Shaikh Rahim, was the mastermind of the killing, police said. Kolhe was killed on June 21 in retaliation for WhatsApp posts supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

175.title: Germany to return Benin Bronzes to Nigeria
175.article_body: Germany and Nigeria have agreed for the return of artefacts, called Benin Bronzes, which were looted from Africa in the 19th Century. The Nigerian government said it would be receiving 1,130 pieces, describing it as the "single largest repatriation of artefacts anywhere in the world". Two pieces kept with the Berlin museum were handed over at the signing meet.

176.title: Maharashtra CM Shinde, rebel Sena MLAs arrive in Mumbai from Goa
176.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, along with his faction of MLAs, on Saturday evening reached Mumbai from Goa, where the rebel Shiv Sena MLAs were camping after returning from Assam's Guwahati. This comes after Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray removed Shinde from the post of leader in the party for indulging in "anti-party activities".

177.title: Pic shows Uber charging ₹3,000 for ride within Mumbai amid rains, Twitter users react
177.article_body: A Twitter user named Shravankumar Suvarna shared a screenshot that showed Uber charging ₹3,041 for a ride within Mumbai. "Flight to Goa is cheaper than my ride home #peakmumbairains," he wrote. "This is extortion not surge pricing," a Twitter user commented. "You can probably get a flight to [Pune] and then take a bus. It'd still...be cheaper," another comment read.

178.title: Typhoon destroys ship off Hong Kong coast; over 2 dozen missing
178.article_body: More than two dozen people were missing after an engineering ship was destroyed by a violent tropical storm, Typhoon Chaba, 300 km off the coast of Hong Kong, officials said on Saturday. Only three crew members have been rescued till now. The typhoon generated wind speeds of 144 km/ph and 10-metre high waves at the location of hitting the ship.

179.title: 6.3 magnitude earthquake hits southern Iran; 5 killed, 44 injured
179.article_body: Five people have died and 44 others have been wounded due to a magnitude 6.3 earthquake that hit southern Iran on Saturday, state media reported. Sayeh Khosh village, 1,000 kilometres south of capital Tehran, in the Hormozgan province has been identified as the epicentre. Tremors from the earthquake were felt in many neighbouring countries, as per the state media.

180.title: Philippines' President vetoes sister's bill for new economic zone
180.article_body: Philippines' President, Ferdinand Marcos Jr, has vetoed a bill sponsored by his lawmaker sister that proposed the creation of a new special economic zone. In his letter to the Congress, Marcos stated, "Fiscal prudence must be exercised particularly at times when resources are scarce and the needs are abundant." Marcos' administration has inherited a government debt of over $200 billion.

181.title: UN, EU condemn Libyan protesters vandalising Parliament building
181.article_body: The United Nations and European Union on Saturday condemned Libyan protesters who vandalised the Parliament Building in Tobruk on Friday, expressing anger against recent hours-long power cuts. Protests demanding electricity were also seen in capital Tripoli. Libya's Parliament shifted to Tobruk from Tripoli after its east-west split in 2014 which resulted in dictator Muammar Gadhafi's ouster.

182.title: Several self-driving cars simultaneously stop working in US, block traffic for hours
182.article_body: More than half a dozen self-driving cars of Cruise simultaneously stopped operating in a San Francisco street recently, blocking the traffic for a couple of hours. The company's employees arrived at the location and had to manually move the autonomous vehicles. Cruise acknowledged the incident without revealing the cause and said, "[The issue] was resolved and no passengers were impacted."

183.title: Two Syrian civilians injured in Israeli military strike in Tartous
183.article_body: Two civilians were injured on Saturday in an Israeli military strike targeting the Syrian province of Tartous, the country's military said. Syrian state news agency SANA reported that Israeli warplanes targeted chicken farms in Hamidiya town, south of Tartous. This is the latest in a series of military strikes that Israel claims is targeted at entities backed by Iran.

184.title: When tiger comes, foxes run away: BJP as T'gana CM skips welcoming PM
184.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport on Saturday, state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar said, "When the tiger comes, foxes run away." "Now, when the tiger has come, he (KCR) is running away. We do not know why is he doing this," Kumar further said.

185.title: Mohanlal receives certificate from CBIC for prompt filing, returns of GST
185.article_body: Actor Mohanlal announced that he received a certificate of appreciation from Finance Ministry's Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) over his prompt filing and returns of GST for the fiscal year 2021-2022. The actor also shared the certificate on social media on Saturday, writing, "I thank the Government of India for their appreciation. Proud to be an Indian."

186.title: Ukraine says link restored to Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant
186.article_body: Ukraine's nuclear power operator Energoatom on Friday informed that it had restored connection to the surveillance systems in the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant which is occupied by Russian forces. The agency added that all the mandatory monitoring data has been shared with UN's atomic watchdog, IAEA. The connection loss was caused due to "occupiers" cutting off all mobile operators, Energoatom said.

187.title: Inspired by vengeful spirit: Priyanka on ED action on Sanjay Raut
187.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised the Centre over action against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, saying it was "inspired by the spirit of revenge and malice". "BJP is adopting every trick to suppress the voices standing in opposition to its anti-democratic politics," Priyanka tweeted. This comes after Raut appeared before ED in connection with a money laundering case.

188.title: SRK, Ranbir, Karan Johar pose with Madhavan on 'Rocketry' set
188.article_body: A picture showing actors Shah Rukh Khan and Ranbir Kapoor along with filmmakers Ayan Mukerji and Karan Johar posing with R Madhavan and Nambi Narayanan has gone viral on social media. The picture was clicked on the sets of Madhavan's debut directorial 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' with him in makeup as Nambi. Shah Rukh makes a cameo appearance in it.

189.title: Anisimova beat fellow American Gauff to enter her first Wimbledon 4th round
189.article_body: American Amanda Anisimova reached the fourth round at Wimbledon for the first time after defeating compatriot and 11th seed Coco Gauff 6-7(4-7), 6-2, 6-1 on Saturday. The 20th seed won the third round match in two hours and seven minutes. It is Gauff's earliest defeat at Wimbledon. Anisimova will next face France's Harmony Tan, who beat wild card Katie Boulter.

190.title: I see my 5-day ED interrogation as a medal: Rahul Gandhi
190.article_body: Speaking in Wayanad, Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he views the five-day Enforcement Directorate interrogation he recently faced as a "medal". He also said, "I wondered why they interrogated me for 5 days, not for 10 days." Rahul Gandhi was interrogated by the ED several times in June over a money laundering case related to the National Herald newspaper.

191.title: By not welcoming PM, KCR jeopardised Constitution's integrity: Irani
191.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Smriti Irani on Saturday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao "jeopardised the integrity of the Constitution" by not attending PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at the Hyderabad airport. She said, "[KCR] has just not insulted an individual but also an institution." Notably, PM Modi arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting today.

192.title: I can tell you're an action hero: Chris Pratt to Sidharth Malhotra
192.article_body: In a recent interaction between the two, Hollywood actor Chris Pratt said that he can tell that actor Sidharth Malhotra is an action hero for sure. "Just look at this guy...We should work out together," he added. Chris and Sidharth also spoke about representing their nation's army personnel onscreen in the show 'The Terminal List' and the film 'Shershaah' respectively.

193.title: 44-year-old woman dies after being struck by lightning in UP
193.article_body: A 44-year-old woman, identified as Kaushali, died and another sustained injuries after being struck by lightning in Ballia district of Uttar Pradesh, police said. ASP of Ballia, Durga Prasad Tewari, said both the women were sowing paddy in their field when they were hit by lightning. Kaushali died on the spot, while another woman suffered serious injuries, ASP Tewari added.

194.title: BJP and RSS are capturing our Constitution: Rahul Gandhi in Kerala
194.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that India's Constitution is "being captured" by the BJP and the RSS. Gandhi stated, "Voice of people is being crushed. But we aren't scared, we won't let them destroy the fabric of the country." He added, "They are attacking the country's economic backbone." Rahul made the statements while addressing a gathering in Kerala.

195.title: Wasim Jaffer trolls England with pic of drunk Flintoff and Pietersen after India score 416
195.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer trolled England after India managed to score 416 runs in their first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. Sharing a picture of drunk Andrew Flintoff and Kevin Pietersen from 2005 Ashes celebrations, Jaffer wrote, "England: Indian total won't be that high. Meanwhile, Indian total: [picture reference] #ENGvIND."

196.title: 30 students injured as school bus falls into ditch in Bengal's Malda
196.article_body: At least 30 students were injured after the school bus they were travelling in fell into a roadside ditch in West Bengal's Malda district on Saturday afternoon, police said. Around 70 students were returning home on the bus when the accident took place, police added. "Two students received serious head injuries, but their condition is stable," Malda SP said.

197.title: Indians can receive up to ₹10 lakh/yr from relatives abroad as govt amends FCRA rules
197.article_body: The government has amended the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA), allowing citizens to receive up to ₹10 lakh per year from relatives staying abroad without disclosing it to the authorities. The limit was earlier set at ₹1 lakh. If the amount exceeds ₹10 lakh, those receiving funds will now have 90 days (instead of 30 days) to inform the government.

198.title: Video of Dravid, Kohli celebrating Jasprit Bumrah's world record goes viral
198.article_body: A video of Rahul Dravid and Virat Kohli celebrating Team India captain Jasprit Bumrah's world record against England has gone viral. In the video, Dravid and Kohli can be seen animatedly celebrating Bumrah's batting. Bumrah smashed four fours and two sixes in Stuart Broad's over. Broad conceded a total of 35 runs in that over, with Bumrah scoring 29 runs.

199.title: 'The Shining' actor Joe Turkel passes away at the age of 94
199.article_body: Actor Joe Turkel, known for 'The Shining' and 'Blade Runner', passed away aged 94 in a hospital in California. He had a 40-year-long career with over 140 acting credits to his name. He retired from acting after doing voice acting for the 'Blade Runner' video game spinoff in 1997. He finished his memoir 'The Misery of Success' before his demise.

200.title: We're 100% ready: Savita ahead of 1st match at Hockey Women's World Cup
200.article_body: Indian women's hockey team captain Savita has said the team's only aim right now is to get on to a good start in the Hockey Women's World Cup 2022 in Spain and Netherlands, adding the team is 100% ready. India will face England on Sunday in their first match in Pool B in Amstelveen, the Netherlands.

201.title: Piyush Goyal to release States' Startup Rankings 2021 on Monday
201.article_body: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will release the results of the third edition of Ranking of States' on Support to Startup Ecosystems on Monday. The third edition evaluated support provided by 24 states and seven UTs between October 2019-July 2021. The States' Startup Ranking Exercise had seven reform areas and 26 action points. Presently, there're over 30 states/UTs with start-up policies.

202.title: Anushka Sharma wraps first schedule of 'Chakda 'Xpress', shares pic
202.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to social media to share a picture of a cricket ball to announce the wrap-up of the first schedule of 'Chakda 'Xpress'. The movie is a biopic on Jhulan Goswami and will feature Anushka playing the role of the cricketer. This will mark the actress' return to films after four years after 2018 film 'Zero'.

203.title: Case filed against Kapil Sharma for breach of North America tour contract
203.article_body: A case has been filed against comedian Kapil Sharma for breaching his contract for the tour of North America in 2015. As per a new report, Sai USA Inc filed the lawsuit as Kapil was paid for six shows but he performed only five of them. The comedian had said he would pay for the loss, Sai USA Inc claimed.

204.title: World no. 115 Tan reaches last 16 for first time at Wimbledon 2022
204.article_body: World number 115 Harmony Tan has reached the fourth round of a Grand Slam for the first time in her career at Wimbledon 2022. She defeated wild card Katie Boulter 6-1, 6-1 in 51 minutes on Saturday. Earlier in the first round, the 24-year-old defeated seven-time champion Serena Williams. Notably, it is Tan's debut at the tournament.

205.title: India responds to US govt report on religious freedom, calls it 'biased & inaccurate'
205.article_body: India has responded after the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) designated India as a "country of particular concern" citing violations of religious freedom. Calling the report "biased and inaccurate", the government said, "These comments reflect a severe lack of understanding of India and its constitutional framework, its plurality and its democratic ethos."

206.title: Audience will have to contribute to change: Taapsee on pay disparity
206.article_body: Speaking about the pay disparity between male and female actors in Bollywood, Taapsee Pannu said that the audience will have to contribute to the change. "Pay parity is not about producers not wanting to give money," the actress added. She said that the audience makes advance bookings for male-driven films but waits for reviews before going for a female-driven film.

207.title: Murmu's victory is certain in Presidential polls: Himachal CM
207.article_body: Addressing a function in Himachal Pradesh's Baddi on Friday, state CM Jairam Thakur said NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu's victory is certain. "Her efforts for the development of tribal areas, education of girls and balanced development of all sections of the society are highly commendable," Thakur said. She has set an example for society throughout her life, Thakur added.

208.title: 35-year-old businessman shot dead, wife injured in Bihar's Katihar
208.article_body: A 35-year-old businessman, Meghnath Yadav, was shot dead by miscreants when he and his wife were returning from a temple in Bihar's Katihar on Saturday morning, police said. Yadav's wife sustained bullet injuries and is undergoing treatment at a hospital. "The deceased had a property dispute with his brother-in-law and the police have started a probe," said SHO Rajeev Jha.

209.title: 7 persons from Assam killed in Manipur landslide
209.article_body: Seven persons from Assam, including two security personnel, were killed in a landslide at Tupul yard railway construction camp in Manipur's Noney, officials said on Saturday. "So far, five persons from Morigaon have been confirmed to have been killed in the landslide," an official said. The death toll in the landslide has increased to 25, while 38 others are missing.

210.title: PM Modi thinks he is Brahma and is permanent: Telangana CM KCR
210.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday said, "[PM Narendra] Modi thinks he is Brahma and is permanent." "There will be political transformation. No one is permanent...People choose their leader, who gets to serve the nation," he added. Rao, daring BJP to topple his government in Telangana, said "I'll become free and then will topple your government in the Centre."

211.title: Was stopped at Delhi airport despite procuring visa: Pulitzer-winning Kashmiri journalist
211.article_body: Pulitzer-winning Kashmiri photojournalist Sanna Irshad Mattoo tweeted that she was stopped by immigration officials at Delhi airport and prevented from travelling to France on Saturday despite procuring a visa. "I wasn't given any reason but told I'd not be able to travel internationally," she added. Sanna was scheduled to travel to Paris for a book launch and photography exhibition.

212.title: I was never a daily soap actor, can't go back to it: Saumya Tandon
212.article_body: Actress Saumya Tandon said she doesn't see herself going back to the daily soap world, adding she was never a daily soap actor to begin with. Saumya portrayed Anita Mishra in 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai!' from 2015 to 2020. "Now is the time to explore the actor in me. I also plan to co-produce a short film," she added.

213.title: He's scared to face PM Modi: BJP as KCR skips PM's welcome at airport
213.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't attend PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport, BJP MLC N Ramchander Rao said that KCR is scared to face the PM. Meanwhile, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "[KCR] has insulted the institution of both...a CM and PM." Notably, PM Modi arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting on Saturday.

214.title: Jannik, I are some of the youngest players left in Wimbledon draw: Alcaraz
214.article_body: Following his third round win at Wimbledon 2022, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz said he and his fourth round opponent, 20-year-old Jannik Sinner, are some of the youngest players left in the draw currently. "Maybe the most talented. But there are a lot of other young guys who play incredibly well," he added. Alcaraz and Sinner are seeded fifth and 10th respectively.

215.title: Mainstream cinema is boring, all actors are interchangeable: Harsh Varrdhan
215.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor has stated that he sees the same repackaged and rehashed version of films in mainstream cinema, adding he finds them really boring. "[I] feel all actors are interchangeable in that format," he said. The actor further said that his 'Bhavesh Joshi Superhero' and 'Thar' stand out because they make very little compromise in terms of creativity.

216.title: PM Modi only believes in confrontation: Opposition's Prez candidate
216.article_body: Opposition's candidate for Presidential elections, Yashwant Sinha, on Saturday said PM Narendra Modi never believed in "consensus" but only "confrontation". He said the elections are being held under "extraordinary circumstances", adding that it is not a fight between two individuals but a battle of ideologies. Notably, BJP-led NDA has announced Draupadi Murmu's name as its Presidential candidate.

217.title: Kolkata Police issues lookout circular against Nupur Sharma
217.article_body: Kolkata Police on Saturday issued a lookout circular against suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. According to police, the circular was issued as Sharma reportedly failed to turn up after she was sent two notices for appearance for interrogation. Last month, widespread violence broke out in several districts over Sharma's remarks.

218.title: Veterinary doctor provoked others to murder Amravati man for supporting Nupur: Police
218.article_body: A 44-year-old veterinary doctor, identified as Yusuf Khan Bahadur Khan, had provoked others to murder Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe who was stabbed to death, police have said. Kolhe was killed for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police stated. "Khan had made a post on a WhatsApp group against Kolhe...This provoked the accused...and they decided to murder him," they added.

219.title: Why is July 2 celebrated as World UFO Day?
219.article_body: World UFO Day, celebrated on July 2, commemorates two days which are first widely reported UFO sightings. First sighting was reported on June 24, 1947, when aviator Kenneth Arnold claimed he saw a 'flying saucer'. Second incident was in New Mexico on July 2, when a ranch owner found debris around his pasture, believed to have fallen from UFO crash.

220.title: If you disagree, close your account: UK bank to customers upset by pronoun badges
220.article_body: UK-based Halifax has said that customers objecting to the company's decision to allow employees to display their pronouns on name badges can close their accounts. The controversy started after Halifax tweeted a picture of a name badge saying "Gemma (she/her/hers)", along with the caption, "Pronouns matter". Halifax said, "If you disagree with our values, you're welcome to close your account."

221.title: Telangana CM skips PM Modi's welcome at airport for the 3rd time, triggers row
221.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't attend PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at the airport as the latter arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting on Saturday. Notably, this is the third time that Rao has skipped PM Modi's welcome ceremony this year. It triggered a political row in the state with BJP criticising the CM's actions.

222.title: UK MP under investigation for sexual misconduct; suspended
222.article_body: Senior UK Parliamentarian Chris Pincher has been suspended from the Conservative Party and will be investigated over allegations of sexual misconduct that he drunkenly groped two men. UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has assented Pincher's suspension till the time he is investigated. Earlier, Pincher resigned as Deputy Chief Whip of the Conservative Party over the incident.

223.title: Fact-checker Mohammed Zubair denied bail, sent to 14-day judicial custody
223.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was on Saturday sent to 14-day judicial custody by the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate of the Patiala House Court in Delhi. His plea for bail has been rejected by the court. The 33-year-old was arrested and booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments in a tweet in 2018.

224.title: Free power, water, healthcare in MP if AAP wins civic polls: Kejriwal
224.article_body: AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday announced that his party would provide free water, electricity and healthcare if voted to power in Madhya Pradesh local body polls. "Congress and BJP have cheated you. Give us a chance...If we don't work, kick us out," he added. "I assure you Singrauli will be developed like Delhi," Kejriwal further said.

225.title: Travelled in locals, got pinched: Raveena to trolling on opposing metro
225.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon responded to a troll who said elites don't understand how Mumbaikers live, tweeting, "Teen yrs, travelled in locals/buses, got eveteased, pinched...that most women go through." Replying to another troll who tagged her in a video of a full local train, she wrote, "Uptil 1991, I travelled like this...also got physically harassed by nameless trolls like you."

226.title: Hyd Police asks Google to remove 221 loan apps over cheating complaints
226.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police have asked Google to remove 221 loan apps from its Play Store after receiving several complaints of harassment and cheating against such apps, Hyderabad Police tweeted on Saturday. Upon receiving the complaints, police said they launched an investigation against the apps and they were found to be illegal. Many were also found to be fake.

227.title: UP CM’s visit to Bhagya Laxmi Temple in Hyd postponed to Sunday: Report
227.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath's visit to the Bhagya Lakshmi Temple at Hyderabad's Charminar has been postponed till Sunday by the Telangana BJP over "important engagements". According to sources cited by The Siasat Daily, the IB has advised the UP CM against visiting the temple over the Nupur Sharma controversy. Yogi Adityanath was supposed to visit the temple on Saturday afternoon.

228.title: 3 arrested for selling bank accounts opened using fake documents in Mumbai
228.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested three cybercriminals who allegedly set up bank accounts using fake documents and sold these accounts to criminals for ₹10,000 each. Their module was busted during the investigation of a cybercrime case where a Mumbai resident lost ₹2 lakh, police said. Police seized 29 debit cards, seven mobile phones, 15 SIM cards and chequebooks from them.

229.title: Man kills brother over property dispute in Palghar, arrested
229.article_body: A 53-year-old man, Chindya Binder, was arrested for allegedly killing his younger brother, 51-year-old Ramesh Binder, over a property dispute in Maharashtra's Palghar, police said. The accused arrived at his brother's house, picked a quarrel with him and attacked him with a sharp weapon, killing him on the spot. Ramesh's body was sent to government hospital for post-mortem, police added.

230.title: 10-yr-old Licypriya shares pics of area around Taj Mahal before & after it was cleaned
230.article_body: Licypriya Kangujam, a 10-year-old climate activist, tweeted pictures of the area around Taj Mahal before and after it was cleaned. "Awesome to see the change and...initiative taken by you," a Twitter user commented. "Congratulations! You made a change," another comment read. "Behind the beauty of Taj Mahal is plastic pollution," she earlier wrote while sharing photo of the trash.

231.title: Is he Yuvi or Bumrah, reminded me of 2007: Sachin on Bumrah's world record
231.article_body: Reacting to Jasprit Bumrah slamming record 29 runs in an over by England pacer Stuart Broad in fifth Test, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Kya yeh Yuvi hai ya Bumrah!? 2007 ki yaad dilaa di. (Is he Yuvi or Bumrah...Reminded me of 2007)." Yuvraj Singh had slammed six sixes in an over bowled by Broad in a 2007 T20 World Cup match.

232.title: Video shows Stuart Broad bowling most expensive over in Test cricket history
232.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad on Saturday bowled the most expensive over in the history of Test cricket, against India in the rescheduled fifth Test. Broad conceded a total of 35 runs, out of which 29 were hit by India captain Jasprit Bumrah and the rest were extras. Broad's over read 4, 5(4+wide), 7(6+no-ball), 4, 4, 4, 6, 1.

233.title: Brother of former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains arrested in rape case
233.article_body: Ludhiana Police in Punjab has arrested Karamjit Singh Bains, brother of former Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains, in an alleged rape case of a 44-year-old woman. Simarjeet, along with his two brothers and four others, have already been declared proclaimed offenders in the case. As per reports, Simarjeet continues to be at large.

234.title: Broad now holds world record for bowling most expensive over in Tests and T20Is
234.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad now holds the world record for bowling the most expensive over in both Test and T20I cricket. Broad conceded 35 runs in an over against India in fifth Test on Saturday to concede most runs in an over in Test history. He had conceded 36 runs in an over against India in 2007 T20 World Cup.

235.title: B'luru Urban Dy Commissioner transferred after ACB questions him
235.article_body: The Karnataka government on Friday transferred Bengaluru Urban Deputy Commissioner J Manjunath, a day after the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) interrogated him in a corruption case. In May 2021, two of Manjunath's staff were arrested while allegedly receiving a ₹5 lakh bribe to get a favourable order from a court. He's now been made Director of the Integrated Child Protection Scheme.

236.title: Studying technical interventions to decongest traffic in B'luru: BBMP official
236.article_body: The Bengaluru civic body is studying technical interventions like automatic signalling and traffic movement at junctions, etc to help reduce congestion in the city, BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath said. "Automatic signalling is one thing suggested by the CM so that traffic can be smoothened," Nath said. Bengaluru has one of the highest traffic to population densities in India.

237.title: Swiatek reminds me a bit of Djokovic: Cornet ahead of 3rd round at Wimbledon
237.article_body: Ahead of her third round match against Iga Swiatek at Wimbledon, unseeded Frenchwoman Alize Cornet said the way the top seed moves and glides on the court reminds her a bit of Novak Djokovic. "I don't know "her ball" yet, I'm yet to discover it but I think she's very strong," she added. Swiatek is on a 37-match winning streak.

238.title: 40-year-old man shot dead outside his office in Delhi
238.article_body: A 40-year-old man was shot dead by unknown persons who opened fire on the victim outside his office in Paschim Vihar, police said on Saturday. Police said an investigation into the matter is in progress, adding that nine teams, including special staff, are working on the case. Meanwhile, police have recovered empty bullet cartridges from the spot.

239.title: Income Tax portal facing issues, Infosys has observed some irregular traffic: Govt
239.article_body: The government on Saturday said it has noticed that taxpayers are facing issues in accessing the Income Tax e-filing portal. "As informed by Infosys, they have observed some irregular traffic on the portal for which proactive measures are being taken," the Income Tax Department wrote on Twitter. The tax e-filing portal built by Infosys was launched on June 7, 2021.

240.title: 18-yr-old UP Dalit boy dies in explosion under cot; probe underway
240.article_body: An 18-year-old Dalit boy was recently killed in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow allegedly after an explosion took place under his cot while he was sleeping. The deceased's father, in his complaint, has said that two upper caste men killed his son over "enmity with the family". "We have four suspects as per the probe," ASP Hirdesh Katheriya said.

241.title: 14 more killed amid floods in Assam; death toll rises to 173
241.article_body: The death toll due to floods and landslides in Assam has risen to 173, according to Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA). This comes after 14 more people, including six children, died after drowning in flood waters in the state in the last 24 hours. Nearly 29.70 lakh people in 30 districts of the state have been affected by floods.

242.title: He is India's best Test batter at the moment: Jaffer on Pant's 111-ball 146
242.article_body: After Rishabh Pant hit 111-ball 146 in rescheduled fifth India-England Test in Edgbaston, Wasim Jaffer said the India wicketkeeper-batter is definitely the best Test batter at the moment. Pant, who scored the hundred in 89 balls, broke MS Dhoni's record for the fastest Test century by an Indian wicketkeeper-batter. Dhoni had smashed a 93-ball hundred against Pakistan in 2006.

243.title: Crowd attacks, tears clothes of Udaipur killing accused outside court; video surfaces
243.article_body: A video has shown a crowd attacking the men accused in Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's killing when they were presented before an NIA court in Jaipur on Saturday. The crowd is seen tearing the clothes of the accused men before police personnel put them in a van outside the court. All four accused were sent to a 10-day NIA remand.

244.title: Israel, Poland criticise Ukrainian envoy for defending WW2 nationalist
244.article_body: Ukraine's ambassador to Germany has been criticised by Israeli and Polish governments for his statement saying Ukrainian nationalist leader Stepan Bandera was not a "mass murderer of Poles and Jews". "The statement...belittles the Holocaust," the Israeli embassy stated. Bandera headed the radical wing of a Ukrainian nationalist group which killed tens of thousands of Poles during World War 2.

245.title: Blasts in Mykolaiv a day after 21 killed near Odesa in Ukraine
245.article_body: Explosions rocked the Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv on Saturday, said the city's mayor. "Stay in shelters!" the mayor warned city residents. This comes a day after at least 21 people were reportedly killed in an alleged Russian missile strike near Odesa. On Friday, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy termed the recent bombardment of Ukrainian cities as "conscious, deliberately targeted Russian terror".

246.title: Karthik criticises ECB over 'Root dismisses dominant Pant' headline for highlights
246.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik criticised England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) for 'Joe Root dismisses dominant Pant' headline of their YouTube video for highlights of Day 1 of the rescheduled fifth Test. Karthik wrote, "After such an engrossing, enthralling day's play, I'm sure the headline can be much better and apt than this." Pant slammed 146 runs off 111 deliveries.

247.title: Activist Teesta Setalvad, ex-Gujarat DGP sent to judicial custody
247.article_body: Activist Teesta Setalvad and former Gujarat DGP RB Sreekumar were on Sunday sent to judicial custody by a court in Ahmedabad. Earlier on June 26, the duo was sent to the Ahmedabad crime branch's custody for questioning till July 2. Their judicial custody will continue until bail is granted. So far, no bail application has been moved.

248.title: My character in 'Shamshera' is both funny, dangerous: Sanjay Dutt
248.article_body: Sanjay Dutt, while talking about his character Shuddh Singh in 'Shamshera', said that it's both funny and dangerous. "Audience should love him!" Sanjay said. "It's a character...you have never seen on screen...I loved the fact that Karan Malhotra created a villain like this and...thought of me to play this role," Sanjay had said earlier. 'Shamshera' also stars Ranbir Kapoor.

249.title: Salah signs new long-term Liverpool contract to extend Anfield stay
249.article_body: Mohamed Salah has signed a new long-term contract to extend his stay at Liverpool, the club announced on Friday. The forward was named FWA Footballer of the Year and PFA Players' Player of the Year for 2021-22 after helping Jürgen Klopp's side to a domestic cup double. Salah has scored 156 goals in 254 club appearances since arriving in 2017.

250.title: BJP's national executive meeting commences in Hyd; PM Modi present
250.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) two-day national executive meeting commenced in Hyderabad on Saturday. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP chief JP Nadda and other party leaders are present in the meeting. Earlier today, PM Modi took to Twitter and informed that a wide range of issues aimed at further strengthening the party will be discussed in the meeting.

251.title: Premarital sex, premarital pregnancy are matters of personal choice: Dia Mirza
251.article_body: Dia Mirza has said even though many are critical of premarital sex and premarital pregnancy, "there are enough people who recognise...it's a personal choice". "I feel when it comes to...personal choice, it can only be celebrated...by...those who ensure they make personal choices," she stated. "I don't think we're as progressive as we imagine...ourselves to be," Dia told Times of India.

252.title: CCTV video shows alleged killers of Amravati man who supported Nupur Sharma
252.article_body: CCTV footage has shown deceased chemist Umesh Kolhe being tailed by his alleged killers in Maharashtra's Amravati. Kolhe was stabbed to death on June 21 after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma. The footage was recorded between 10 pm and 10.30 pm when Kolhe was reportedly waylaid by the accused while he was returning home from his pharmacy.

253.title: Keep the flag high, proud of you: Harbhajan on Jadeja's ton in 5th Test
253.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to praise Ravindra Jadeja following the India all-rounder's century in the first innings of rescheduled fifth Test against England. "Jadeja, that's one of the best inn [innings]...what a 100...keep the flag high...Jadeja very proud of you," he wrote. Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Valuable hundred baapu. Batting at his peak of ability." Jadeja scored a 194-ball 104.

254.title: Audience didn't want to let go of my image after Mohabbatein: Preeti
254.article_body: Preeti Jhangiani, who made her Bollywood debut with Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Mohabbatein in 2000, said the audience had a certain image of her after the film which they didn't wanted to let go. "But...times have completely changed now, so I don't think that's an issue," she said, adding that she might return to acting if she gets an interesting role.

255.title: Father-son make video of married woman, blackmail her for money in Mysuru
255.article_body: Karnataka Police have booked father and son for allegedly blackmailing a married woman with her private video in Mysuru. The accused, who lived near the woman's house, allegedly recorded her video on phone while bathing and had been using it to blackmail her to extract money for the past two years. As per authorities, they also harassed her sexually.

256.title: Former Kerala MLA PC George arrested in sexual harassment case
256.article_body: Senior Kerala politician and former MLA PC George was on Saturday arrested on charges of sexually harassing a woman, who is also an accused in the solar panel case. George reportedly claimed that he was arrested as part of a conspiracy by CM Pinarayi Vijayan. The woman has alleged that George had invited her to the guest house in Thycaud.

257.title: 35,870 Russian soldiers killed, 1,582 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
257.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed around 35,870 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. As per Ukraine's Foreign Ministry, its forces have destroyed 1,582 Russian tanks and over 400 aircraft, including 186 helicopters. The ministry said that 3,737 armoured personnel carriers, 800 artillery systems and 246 multiple launch rocket systems have also been destroyed.

258.title: Messaged Świątek a couple of times as her gameplay has been crazy: Nadal
258.article_body: Talking about world number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek who's on a 37-match unbeaten run, Rafael Nadal said, "I've messaged [Iga] a couple of times because what she's playing is crazy." "The way she's able to keep her focus and winning spirit for so long is unbelievable...I'm quite happy that a girl like her is so successful," added Nadal.

259.title: My films get made, what can I do: Akshay on Madhavan's 40 day remark
259.article_body: On being asked about R Madhavan's comment on actors giving only 40-45 days to shoot a film, actor Akshay Kumar said, "My films get made, what can I do? It's not in my control that my films wrap up so fast." The actor further said, "If a director...tells me my work is done, go home, should I fight with him?"

260.title: Husband is very supportive of my political career, it has shocked me: Urmila
260.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar said in an interview that her husband, Mohsin Akhtar, has been "so extremely supportive" of her political career that it has shocked her. "He has given me more strength to speak my mind out, the way I have been speaking," Urmila said, adding, "After being...a blessed daughter, I am a blessed wife and a daughter-in-law."

261.title: Root knows DNA of Test cricket; that's what makes him great: Chopra
261.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that English batter Joe Root knows the "DNA of Test cricket" and that makes him "great". "Root likes to cut the ball or use the backfoot punch or pull and knows how to build his innings," Chopra said. "There is a very small window of opportunity to get Root out," he added.

262.title: PM Modi has not actually understand MGNREGA: Rahul Gandhi
262.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was "shocked" when PM Narendra Modi spoke against the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) in Lok Sabha. "PM called [MGNREGA] a living monument of the failures of the UPA," Gandhi said. "It made me realise that the PM actually had not understood the depth of MGNREGA," he added.

263.title: Woman kills 3-yr-old daughter before dying by suicide in Bengaluru
263.article_body: A 31-year-old woman allegedly killed her 3-year-old daughter and later died by suicide at her apartment in Bengaluru's RR Nagar on Thursday. According to police, the deceased was depressed over her health issues. Her husband who works as a software engineer also lived with them in the apartment. An investigation is underway to ascertain whether the couple had marital problems.

264.title: Taron Egerton confirms meeting Marvel chief for Wolverine role
264.article_body: Actor Taron Egerton in an interview with The New York Times confirmed that he has been in talks with Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige and other executives about taking on the role of Wolverine, previously played by Hugh Jackman. "Hopefully if it does come around, they'll give me a shot," the 'Rocketman' actor added.

265.title: Nikki tests COVID positive for 2nd time, says couldn't breathe at one point
265.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has tested positive for COVID-19. The actress stated that she initially neglected the symptoms assuming it to be a change in weather. "However, when I was coming back to Mumbai in...flight, I just couldn't breathe at one point," Nikki added. Notably, this is the second time that Nikki has tested positive for the virus.

266.title: Got to win overseas Tests to become world number 1: Pat Cummins
266.article_body: After winning the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle, Australian skipper Pat Cummins said that one needs to win overseas Tests to be the world's "number one" team. "...Mitchell Starc working on the reverse swing, Nathan Lyon coming up with a few new balls. There is so much to learn and be successful on these (Lankan) wickets," Cummins said.

267.title: Elon Musk tweets tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who died from cancer at 23
267.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted a tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who passed away due to stage four cancer on July 1. "Cancer is an absurd piece of literal garbage and death," the image shared by Musk read. Technoblade, whose real name was revealed as Alex after his death, had more than 12 million subscribers on YouTube.

268.title: 'Zubair's bail plea order leaked by Delhi DCP', says his lawyer; officer clarifies
268.article_body: After reports claimed that the bail plea of fact-checker Mohammed Zubair was rejected by a Delhi court, Zubair's lawyer said the order was "leaked" to the media by Delhi DCP KPS Malhotra. Advocate Soutik Banerjee said the judge has reserved the matter for judgment and called Malhotra's actions "scandalous". Malhotra clarified that he "misheard" the order that was "inadvertently" broadcast.

269.title: Terrible feeling to be in opposing box against Novak: Ex-coach Vajda
269.article_body: Novak Djokovic's former coach Marian Vajda, who coached the tennis player for 15 years, said it was "very strange to be in the opposing box" against Djokovic during a French Open 2022 match. Tennis player Alex Molcan, who's being coached by Vajda, played against Djokovic in the second round. "It was a terrible feeling...Novak...also felt very bad," stated Vajda.

270.title: 91-yr-old billionaire Rupert Murdoch's 4th wife Jerry files for divorce after 6 yrs
270.article_body: Model Jerry Hall has filed for divorce from media tycoon Rupert Murdoch after six years of marriage. Hall has cited "irreconcilable differences" between her and Murdoch, and sought unspecified spousal support from the 91-year-old billionaire. This will be the fourth divorce for Murdoch. The 66-year-old model was previously the long-term partner of The Rolling Stones' lead vocalist Mick Jagger.

271.title: Do something honourable about your honour: Anupam on SC's statement on Nupur
271.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher reacted to the Supreme Court's statement on former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, tweeting, "Your Honour! Do something honourable about your HONOUR!" The Supreme Court had stated, "She has a threat or she has become a security threat?...This lady is single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country. We saw the debate."

272.title: HIV speeds up body’s ageing process soon after infection: Study
272.article_body: HIV has an early and substantial impact on the process of ageing, a study has found. Highlighting the need for early diagnosis of the infection, the study stated that HIV can start impacting ageing within just two to three years of contracting the virus. Moreover, HIV may rapidly cut about five years off an individual's life span, it stated.

273.title: Govt grants financial help to families of 35 deceased journalists
273.article_body: The central government has approved a proposal of the Journalist Welfare Scheme Committee to provide financial relief of ₹5 lakh to the families of 35 deceased journalists, including those who died due to COVID-19. The committee has also recommended assistance to two journalists suffering from permanent disability. The committee has approved a total assistance of ₹1.81 crore during a meeting.

274.title: Gambia bans all timber exports to combat rosewood smuggling
274.article_body: The Gambia on Friday banned timber exports and revoked all timber export licences to combat the illegal smuggling of endangered rosewood. The government has also instructed port authorities to oversee and prevent any loading of logs onto any vessels. The West African nation has exported an estimated 1.6 million rosewood trees since 2012, according to the Environmental Investigation Agency.

275.title: Shoes, jackets, ornaments barred for Himachal police re-exam after paper leak
275.article_body: Following the paper leak of the written test held in March to recruit Himachal Pradesh Police constables, examinees taking the re-examination on Sunday have been prohibited from wearing jackets and metal ornaments in the examination hall. The examinees also have been asked to wear slippers and flip-flops, instead of socks and shoes. They have been barred from carrying electronic devices.

276.title: Priyanka's brand criticised for being overpriced, people point out tablecloth worth ₹30,000
276.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, who recently launched her homeware brand SONA Home, has been called out for keeping the prices of the items 'exorbitantly high'. "I wanna be rich to a point where I can casually buy a SONA Home tablecloth worth ₹30,000," a tweet read. "Whitewashed millionaire Indian selling overpriced bulls**t to goras as 'exotic' Indian designs," another person commented.

277.title: Ranveer Singh made Alauddin Khilji in Padmaavat look 'terrifying': Ranbir
277.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent video shared by Yash Raj Films, praised actors who have essayed negative roles in films. "In Padmaavat, Ranveer...made Alauddin Khilji so terrifying, that even after...film ends, the character stays with you," Ranbir said. He also called Shah Rukh Khan's role in 'Darr' the "most iconic". "My dream is to play a negative role," Ranbir added.

278.title: I would've been fined 15,000 pounds: Kyrgios on Bublik's underarm serves
278.article_body: Discussing tennis player Alexander Bublik's six underarm serves in his third round match of Wimbledon 2022, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios tweeted, "If it was me, I [would've been]...fined a minimum of 15,000 pounds." Kyrgios added he would have also been "accused of tanking". Kyrgios was recently seen spitting in the direction of an abusive spectator during a Wimbledon match.

279.title: Single-use plastic ban good, but alternatives are costly: Traders
279.article_body: As single-use plastic  (SUP) items have been banned in India, Delhi traders selling these items said alternatives to SUPs are few and costly. Delhi-based Rajeev Sahni, who runs a shop selling disposables, said, "The ban...is good. But we need easily available [and] pocket-friendly alternatives." "Customers are running away now since prices of (alternatives to SUPs) have risen," a wholesaler said.

280.title: Delhi Police constable kills self with service pistol; body found in car
280.article_body: A Delhi Police constable allegedly shot himself dead with his service revolver in Prashant Vihar, Delhi. The deceased, Amandeep Singh, was posted at the Prashant Vihar Police Station and was on casual leaves. The deceased's body was found lying inside a car parked near a petrol pump, police said. Notably, the body has been sent for post-mortem, police added.

281.title: Jasprit Bumrah breaks world record for scoring most runs in an over in a Test match
281.article_body: India captain Jasprit Bumrah on Saturday broke the world record for scoring the most runs in an over in a Test. The 28-year-old scored 29 runs off Stuart Broad's over in first innings of rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston. Bumrah slammed four fours and two sixes, and took a single. Broad conceded 35 runs in the over, including six extras.

282.title: Dad told me my films are good but they won't make me a national star: Ranbir
282.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed that his father, Rishi Kapoor, would tell him that the kind of films he does are good but they won't make him a "national star". "Now I understand...what he was trying to say," he added. Ranbir further said he always looks at his favourite heroes "from a low angle", adding, "I never see them as...equal to me."

283.title: PM Modi govt spends 6 times more on railways in Gujarat than UPA: Shah
283.article_body: Addressing a gathering in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that PM Narendra Modi-led Central government spends six times more money annually on railways in Gujarat than the previous UPA government. "UPA used to spend ₹590 crore every year on the railways in Gujarat. PM Modi increased this spending to ₹3,960 crore between 2014 and 2022," Shah added.

284.title: Modi govt is successfully killing democracy everyday: Telangana CM
284.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has accused the BJP-led Centre of "killing" democracy. "What the Modi administration is doing is successfully killing democracy everyday, throttling the federal system...toppling governments which do not toe their line," CM Rao said. "PM Modi is the 15th PM...and in terms of the last 14 PMs, never has India's image been affected," he added.

285.title: Bulgaria destroys Soviet-era naval mine off its Black Sea coast
285.article_body: Bulgaria's Defence Ministry said its military has carried out a controlled explosion of a Soviet-era naval mine that had drifted close to the country's Black Sea coast. The mine was first spotted by a motor ship, it added. Black Sea countries began to report the appearance of such mines floating in the sea after Russia began invading Ukraine in February.

286.title: India score 35 runs as Stuart Broad bowls most expensive over in Test cricket history
286.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad on Saturday bowled the most expensive over in Test history after India aggregated 35 runs from his 18th over in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test. India captain Jasprit Bumrah scored 29 runs off the over, while the remaining runs came off extras.  The previous most expensive over in Test history went for 28 runs.

287.title: BJP denies link to Udaipur killing accused as pics of him with local leaders emerge
287.article_body: After several pictures showing Udaipur killing accused Riyaz Akhtari with members of the Rajasthan BJP surfaced online, the party denied having any links with him. "Anyone can have a photo with any leader. It doesn't mean that he's a member," said Rajasthan's BJP Minority Morcha chief Mohammad Sadiq Khan. An India Today report said Akhtari had attended BJP events.

288.title: Heavy jewellery in 'Chamma Chamma' could have got me hospitalised: Urmila
288.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar, while talking about her song 'Chamma Chamma', recalled how director Rajkumar Santoshi told her to reduce the jewellery she was wearing as they were too heavy for dancing. The actress said that she refused and was later hit by the ornaments during the shoot. "By...end of those four days, I could've been hospitalised from all...scratches," she added.

289.title: Haven't seen him on set: Mandar on reports of Raj Anadkat quitting 'Taarak...'
289.article_body: Actor Mandar Chandwadkar, who plays Bhide on 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has reacted to reports claiming actor Raj Anadkat has quit the show. "As artists, we don't know if he has quit...but he'd some health issues due to which he hasn't been shooting for...past few days. I haven't seen him on...set," he said. Raj plays Tapu on the show.

290.title: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia opens 1.2 km km-long Benito Juarez Marg underpass
290.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday inaugurated the 1.2 km-long Y-shaped Benito Juarez Marg underpass. The underpass starts at the Delhi Metro's Durgabai Deshmukh South Campus station and connects the South Campus to AIIMS and Moti Bagh. "Adding to the economic value of saving time, this underpass will save ₹18 crore for Delhiites every year," Sisodia tweeted.

291.title: Govt warns edtech firms against unfair trade practices, misleading ads
291.article_body: The Central government has warned edtech companies against unfair trade practices and said that if self-regulation doesn't curb such practices, stringent guidelines will be formulated. Consumer Affairs Secretary Rohit Kumar Singh flagged concerns over misleading ads and increasing fake reviews. Notably, the education category was the largest violator of advertising code in 2021-22, as per ASCI.

292.title: Viruses make people more attractive to mosquitoes: Study
292.article_body: Mosquitoes choose their target on basis of people's body temperature, odour and CO2 from their breath. Some viruses alter body odour in a way that makes people more attractive to mosquitoes, a study stated. They can also transfer the virus from an infected person to another person through bites. Researchers also found that mosquitoes are more attracted to acetophenone's odour.

293.title: Delhi court rejects Zubair's bail plea, sends him to 14-day judicial custody
293.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday rejected Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair's bail plea and sent him to a 14-day judicial custody in a case related to an "objectionable" tweet he had posted in 2018. Delhi Police produced Zubair before the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate and sought a 14-day custody after seizing his mobile phone and recovering a hard disk during investigation.

294.title: Anand Mahindra shares pics from Pant's knock against England, says 'Test cricket tandav'
294.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a collage of pictures from Rishabh Pant's 146-run knock against England in the rescheduled fifth Test. "Test cricket tandav. Rishabh Pant is a sports artiste. Impossible not to marvel at him," Mahindra wrote alongside the collage. Rishabh recorded the fastest Test hundred by a Team India wicketkeeper off 89 deliveries.

295.title: Mithali shares letter PM Modi wrote on her retirement, says 'I'll treasure this forever'
295.article_body: Former India Women captain Mithali Raj took to Twitter to share a letter PM Modi wrote to her while congratulating her on her retirement. "It’s a matter of singular honour & pride when one receives such warm encouragement from our Hon'ble PM Shri Narendra Modi ji," she wrote. She added, "I will treasure this forever."

296.title: Smashed glass on face to get audience's attention: Machine Gun Kelly
296.article_body: Speaking about smashing a champagne glass on his face mid-concert in New York, singer Machine Gun Kelly said he did it to get the audience's attention. "You know when you clink a champagne glass with a fork to kind of [get people's attention]? Yeah, well, I didn't have a fork. So I just clinked it on my head," he said.

297.title: Sania Mirza and Mate Pavic enter 2nd round of Wimbledon mixed doubles
297.article_body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza, who is making her final Wimbledon appearance, and Mate Pavic have entered mixed doubles second round after a win over David Vega Hernandez and Natela Dzalamidze on Friday. The sixth seeds defeated the unseeded pair 6-4, 3-6, 7-6(10-3) on Friday. Sania has already announced her retirement at the end of this season.

298.title: 3 bike-borne men killed after being hit by vehicle in UP's Firozabad
298.article_body: Three men travelling on a motorcycle were killed after being hit by a vehicle in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad district on Friday. The deceased, identified as Jaicharan (25), Ganesh (23) and Narendra (24), were travelling to Delhi from Banda before being hit by the unidentified vehicle. Two of them were from Banda while the remaining one was from Sultanpur, police said.

299.title: Naming colonies after PM, Chief Minister in Bihar unethical: RJD leader
299.article_body: RJD leader Shivanand Tiwary on Friday criticised the proposal to name residential colonies for the homeless in Bihar after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. "To name a scheme that uses public funds after a living person...would be unethical," he said. "It should be named after any luminary from our state with an underprivileged background," Tiwary suggested.

300.title: B'luru police clear road after complaint on 'autos parked haphazardly'
300.article_body: Bengaluru's HAL Airport Traffic police tweeted on Friday that they have cleared the road and put a 'no parking' sign after a Twitter user complained about many autos parked "haphazardly" on the Suranjan Das road. The Twitter user had tagged Bengaluru City Traffic police and said, "[Is] this a designated auto stand?... Why are you not taking this seriously?"

301.title: Thousands rally in Australia against overturning of US abortion law
301.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets of Australia on Saturday to rally against the US Supreme Court's decision to overturn a ruling that legalised abortion. Protesters were seen holding placards that read "Hands off my uterus" and "I'll not quietly go back to the 1950s". "Abortion is healthcare and every woman deserves a right to that," a protester said.

302.title: Ravindra Jadeja smashes his first international hundred outside India
302.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja on Saturday completed his first-ever overseas hundred in international cricket. The 33-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 183 deliveries in India's first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test against England at Edgbaston. Overall, it is Jadeja's third hundred in Test cricket. Jadeja's first two hundreds had come in Rajkot and Mohali.

303.title: Judge asked dad if he's okay if I don't get married after adoption: Sushmita
303.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen has revealed that during the adoption hearing for her first daughter Renee, the judge asked her father if he is okay with her decision because it would affect her marriage plans. The actress said that her father stated he had never raised Sushmita to only be someone's wife. Sushmita added that she was sobbing during the hearing.

304.title: PMC extends deadline for regularisation of illegal homes
304.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has extended the deadline for regularisation of illegal homes made on small plots under the Gunthewari scheme till March 31, 2023. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar urged citizens to take benefit of the scheme, under which unauthorised small plots can reportedly have legal construction for 20 years. Notably, the deadline has been extended for the fourth time.

305.title: Musk breaks his 9-day silence on Twitter, shares pic of him and his kids with Pope
305.article_body: Elon Musk broke his nine-day silence on Twitter, the social media platform he is trying to buy for $44 billion, by posting a picture of him meeting Pope Francis. The world's richest person tweeted, "Honored to meet the Pope yesterday." Musk's four teenage boys can also be seen in the picture.

306.title: It felt like a new journey started: Aditya on transition from TV to films
306.article_body: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur, who worked as a VJ (video jockey) on a music channel before entering Bollywood, called his transition from TV to films "seamless". "When I did get into film, it just felt like a new journey started," he added. The actor, who also hosted a TV show, called the television audience "very different" from that of films.

307.title: Every day at least 1 or 2 Afghan women die by suicide: Ex-Dy Speaker
307.article_body: Former Deputy Speaker of the Afghan Parliament Fawzia Koofi told Human Rights Council that every day at least one or two women die by suicide "due to...lack of opportunity and mental health pressures" in Afghanistan. "Girls as young as nine...are being sold, not only because of economic pressure but because...there's no hope for them, for their family," she added.

308.title: Southwest Monsoon covers entire country six days before normal date
308.article_body: The Southwest Monsoon has already covered the whole of India as of Saturday, said the latest India Meteorological Department (IMD) bulletin. The monsoon has advanced into the remaining parts of the North Arabian Sea, Gujarat and Rajasthan on July 2, six days earlier than the expected date. This comes as widespread rains continued in several parts of India.

309.title: Brave ball by Root to dismiss Pant who batted out of his skin: Collingwood
309.article_body: England assistant coach Paul Collingwood said Rishabh Pant batted out of his skin during his 146 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England. "It was a brave ball from Joe Root [to dismiss Pant]...but sometimes you need a bit of genius," he added. "When you watch someone as exciting as Pant, you've got to applaud," stated Collingwood.

310.title: Delhi likely to receive rainfall throughout the upcoming week: IMD
310.article_body: IMD has predicted that Delhi is expected to receive rains during the upcoming week (July 2-8). According to IMD, light rainfall is likely in the city on Saturday, Sunday and Monday, while heavy showers are expected on Wednesday. The maximum temperature is likely to range from 32-36°C, while the minimum temperature could range between 24-27°C over the next six days.

311.title: Govt orders NIA probe in killing of Amravati man who supported Nupur Sharma
311.article_body: The government has handed over the investigation into the June 21 killing of Maharashtra man Umesh Kolhe to the NIA. Amravati's Kolhe was stabbed to death after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police said. "The conspiracy behind the killing, involvement of organisations, international linkages would be thoroughly investigated," said Home Minister's Office.

312.title: I was starstruck when I met Amitabh Bachchan: Madhuri Dixit
312.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has revealed that the first time she ever got starstruck on set was when she met veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan. The actress added that she got a little tongue-tied when she met him. Madhuri made a special appearance in the song 'Makhna' in 1998 film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' which also stars Govinda and Raveena Tandon.

313.title: Delhi man fakes robbery to use wife's money to clear debts; booked
313.article_body: Delhi Police have booked a man who allegedly made a fake robbery story of ₹2 lakh in a bid to use his wife's money to pay off his debts. Police investigation revealed the accused had incurred heavy losses during the COVID-19 pandemic and was in debt. Meanwhile, police have recovered the amount, which he had kept hidden in his car.

314.title: He was a new director: Mukesh on paying ₹7 lakh to Basu for 'Saaya' & 'Murder'
314.article_body: Producer Mukesh Bhatt has reacted to filmmaker Anurag Basu's old statement wherein he stated that he was paid just ₹7 lakh to direct both 'Saaya' and 'Murder'. Mukesh said, "He was a new director." He added, "Moreover, John Abraham was also a newcomer...So, for a film (Saaya) comprising a newcomer and a new director, what recovery can you expect?"

315.title: 6 students from Pune win national competition on rural innovation
315.article_body: A team of six students from Pune's Sanskriti School has won a national competition on rural innovation. As part of 'Future Entrepreneurs 2021', the students have designed a farmer-friendly product based on the theme of rural ecosystem. "The product we have innovated can help to clean cattle in 10-15 minutes with longer brushes which are automated," one of them said.

316.title: ₹1.65 crore modular operation theatre inaugurated at Pune hospital
316.article_body: A state-of-the-art modular operation theatre built for ₹1.65 crore was inaugurated at Pune's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Cantonment General Hospital on Friday. The operation theatre was funded under corporate social responsibility. The Pune Cantonment Board's CEO Subrat Pal thanked people for their financial assistance and said that the hospital will continue to provide good service in the future.

317.title: China's Great Wall Motors drops $1 bn India entry plan, reportedly fires staff
317.article_body: Chinese carmaker Great Wall Motors has abandoned its $1-billion plan to enter the Indian market. The development comes after the company failed to get the government's approval to acquire General Motors' Talegaon plant near Pune after waiting for two and a half years. The company has shut its India office and terminated its team of 8-10 employees, as per reports.

318.title: Man stabbed to death after sharing WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma in Maha
318.article_body: A man named Umesh Kolhe was stabbed to death in Maharashtra's Amravati on June 21 after he shared a post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma on some WhatsApp groups, police said. At least five people have been arrested for the 54-year-old's murder. The incident took place a week before Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal was beheaded for supporting Sharma.

319.title: Scared to go on pothole-filled, chaotic Mumbai roads: Hema Malini
319.article_body: Actress-turned-politician Hema Malini spoke about the roads of Mumbai, saying that she is scared to go on them due to the traffic and chaos. "I just can't imagine how a pregnant woman must be travelling on these roads that are full of potholes," she added. Hema further said that places like Delhi and Mathura have traffic but it is streamlined.

320.title: Don't know how he's out of form for so long: Manjrekar on Kohli's dismissal
320.article_body: Sanjay Manjrekar said he "doesn't know" how Virat Kohli's been out of form for "so long" having been dismissed for 11 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England. "When great batters go out of form, they come back in form quickly," added Manjrekar. "The confidence has gone down...he's enduring...bad luck, also there are technical issues," he stated.

321.title: Delhi woman slips from stairs, dies as mangalsutra slits her throat
321.article_body: A 22-year-old woman died after allegedly falling from the stairs in her house in Delhi. Police said, prima facie, the injuries suggest that her mangalsutra got entangled around her neck and slit her throat. "Her four-year-old son was with her...He told the police that his mother had gone to the terrace to put clothes to dry," an officer said.

322.title: Another landslide hits Manipur as death toll from previous one rises to 24
322.article_body: The death toll due to the landslide at Tupul in Manipur's Noney has risen to 24, officials said. Notably, another landslide hit the state on Saturday at a construction site in Noney. The first landslide occurred on Wednesday where a company of the 107 Territorial Army (TA) was deployed at a construction site near the Tupul yard railway construction site.

323.title: Want to uplift people through infra development: Droupadi Murmu
323.article_body: While addressing a function in Himachal Pradesh's Baddi on Friday, NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu said she wants to uplift people through infrastructure development at the grassroots level. She also praised Himachal for "showing the way to the country in various parameters of development". Supporting Murmu, CM Jai Ram Thakur said that her victory in the Presidential poll is certain.

324.title: 52-yr-old woman trampled to death by an elephant in Chhattisgarh
324.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was trampled to death by an elephant in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur on Thursday night, a forest official said. "An elephant entered the house of Gurbari Bai and killed her while she was asleep. The tusker reportedly reached the village from the Jharkhand border," the official said. Financial aid of ₹25,000 was given to the family members, he added.

325.title: Pune to receive light showers for next few days: IMD
325.article_body: After light rainfall was reported in Pune on Friday, the India Meteorological Department has said that the light showers are going to continue for the next few days in the district. "There are packed isobars due to the presence of offshore trough and strong westerlies...[Therefore,] rainfall is likely to continue," an official said. Notably, Lavale recorded 7 mm rainfall yesterday.

326.title: Cost of electric vehicles should be affordable for common man: Bommai
326.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday appealed to the automobile manufacturers to focus on making electric vehicles which are affordable for the common man. "Then only its usage could see an increase," Bommai said. After inaugurating 152 EV charging stations in Bengaluru, he said, "The state government has decided to induct more EV buses into Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC)."

327.title: Will she dump Yashwant?: Malviya after Mamata's remarks on Murmu
327.article_body: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she could've considered NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu as a consensus candidate, BJP leader Amit Malviya said, "Will she dump [Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha]?" He also claimed that Mamata has realised that her anti-tribal and anti-woman position is "untenable". "Murmu is more likely to win...polls," Mamata had said.

328.title: Only 30% in 12-15 yrs group received 2nd COVID dose in Pune: Health dept
328.article_body: Around 29.62% of beneficiaries in the 12-15 years age group have received their second COVID dose in Pune. According to the state health department, around 55.21% of the beneficiaries have received their first COVID dose. However, Pune's numbers are lagging behind the state's average figures which are at 60.1% for the first dose and 31.01% for second dose beneficiaries.

329.title: I have no idea why Jayeshbhai Jordaar didn't work: Boman Irani
329.article_body: Boman Irani, speaking about the underwhelming performance of 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' at the box office, said, "I've no idea why [it] didn't work...and I don't want to analyse it too." He added that the intention of the film was very good. Boman further said 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' was a great experience, and he loved what director Divyang Thakkar was trying to say.

330.title: 4 houses collapse in Mumbai's Chunabhatti, no casualties reported
330.article_body: Amid heavy rains, four houses collapsed in Mumbai's Chunabhatti area on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. No casualties or injuries were reported from the incident. This comes after a portion of a 100-year-old building in Mumbai's Kalbadevi collapsed on Thursday. Another such incident was reported in Sion where a portion of ground-plus-five structures fell.

331.title: US truck driver who thought he won ₹1.5 lakh lottery, hits ₹7.5 cr jackpot
331.article_body: A truck driver in the US hit a jackpot of $1 million (₹7.5 crore) on a lottery ticket he initially thought had $2,000 (₹1.5 lakh) prize. "I didn't believe it was real until I called the lottery office to confirm my prize," the driver said. The driver plans to buy a new vehicle with the money and save the rest.

332.title: Karate champ Amritpal dedicates gold medal to Sonu Sood for helping with her surgery
332.article_body: Karate champion Amritpal Kaur dedicated her All India Karate Championship gold medal to Sonu Sood, who had helped with her knee surgery two years ago. "Sonu sir came to my aid when I was at my lowest," she wrote. The actor also shared pictures, writing, "When you see...positive impact you've had in other's lives...it makes your life even more worthwhile."

333.title: Edibles containing drug responsible for effects of marijuana legalised in Minnesota
333.article_body: A new Minnesota law allowing people 21 and older to buy edibles and beverages containing THC, the substance responsible for effects of marijuana on a person's mental state, has come into effect. Edibles and beverages can contain up to 5 milligrams of THC per serving and 50 milligrams per package. "This stuff will get you high," a lawyer said.

334.title: Rakul plays golf with Kapil Dev & Sadhguru in Washington DC, shares video
334.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh took to Instagram to share a video of her playing golf with Kapil Dev and Sadhguru. "What better than kickstarting ATA convention at Washington DC with @sadhguru @therealkapildev," she wrote. Reacting to Rakul's post, a fan wrote, "Amazing." Rakul, who was recently seen in 'Runway 34', will next be seen alongside Ayushmann Khurrana in 'Doctor G'.

335.title: Dinesh Karthik captains India in T20 practice match against Derbyshire, fans react
335.article_body: Dinesh Karthik, who is the senior-most member of India's current T20I squad, captained the team against Derbyshire in a T20 practice match on Friday. "Honestly speaking, I never imagined I will see Karthik leading Team India...in my lifetime. Though it's a mere practice match," a fan tweeted. "So so happy to see you in the captaincy role," wrote another.

336.title: He looked composed; unlucky to get out like that: Swann on Kohli
336.article_body: Former English spinner Graeme Swann said that the way Indian batter Virat Kohli was dismissed on Day 1 of the fifth Test was "quite unlucky" for the former Indian skipper. "Kohli looked really composed out there...if you see his legs, he was trying to get outside the off-stump...He looked devastated when he got out...as he wanted it today," Swann said.

337.title: I don't play in same manner so that bowler gets mentally disturbed: Pant
337.article_body: Following his 146 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England, Rishabh Pant said, "I keep trying that I don't play in the same manner so that the bowler gets mentally disturbed." "Especially in conditions like England where...the bowler is bowling well...it becomes important to disturb his...line and length," added Pant. Pant had a strike rate of 131.53.

338.title: Don't forget to enjoy our Dum Biryani: KTR to BJP ahead of Hyd meet
338.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday took to Twitter to mock BJP ahead of its national executive meet in Hyderabad, saying, "To all the Jhumla Jeevis; Don’t forget to enjoy our Dum Biryani and Irani Chai." He also called the BJP a "WhatsApp University". "Please visit, take notes and try to implement in your states," he added.

339.title: California to end arrests for loitering for prostitution
339.article_body: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed a new state law that will stop police from arresting people for loitering for prostitution. "To be clear, this bill doesn't legalise prostitution," Newsom said. "It simply revokes provisions of the law that have led to disproportionate harassment of women" and transgender adults, he added, noting that Black and Latino women are particularly affected.

340.title: Footpath cracks open following landslide in Mumbai's Peddar Road area
340.article_body: Continuous rainfall in South Mumbai triggered a landslide on Thursday midnight near an under-construction building in the Tony Peddar Road area of Mumbai. The landslide resulted in the footpath along the stretch to crack wide open. According to BMC officials, no casualties were reported as there was no one on the footpath at the time of the incident.

341.title: NIA court convicts 5 members of banned outfit SIMI in Bijnor blast case
341.article_body: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has convicted five members of the banned outfit SIMI in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor blast case. The convicts have been sentenced to rigorous imprisonment from three years to a maximum of seven years and 10 months for various offences. The case relates to an explosion that took place in a house in Bijnor in 2014.

342.title: Harassed by moneylenders, family of 3 jump in canal & die in Punjab
342.article_body: A couple and their 10-year-old son allegedly jumped into the Kotla branch canal and died over harassment by moneylenders and due to their poor financial conditions in Punjab's Mansa. Two of the bodies have been recovered from the canal so far, an investigating officer said. The police also found a purported suicide note written on the son's notebook.

343.title: Had no plan to play at Wimbledon; saw grass, got excited: Venus
343.article_body: Former Grand Slam champion Venus Williams made a comeback at Wimbledon after being away from the court for almost a year. The 42-year-old American and her British partner Jamie Murray secured a win in their first round of the mixed-doubles event on Friday. "I had no plan to play (at Wimbledon). I saw the grass and got excited," Venus said.

344.title: 2 minor boys engaged in child labour rescued in Hyderabad
344.article_body: The SHE Teams of Rachakonda Police along with Operation Muskan Team on Friday rescued two minor boys engaged in child labour in Hyderabad. The boys belong to Bihar and were working at a service centre at Bandlaguda, under the limits of LB Nagar police station, Rachakonda Police said. The police also counselled their guardian about the Child Labour Act.

345.title: Jadeja's 83* was equally important as Pant's 146: Giles on Day 1
345.article_body: Ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said Ravindra Jadeja's 83* on Day 1 of the fifth Test against England was almost as important as Rishabh Pant's 146. "Someone had to be [the] anchor to allow Pant to play that way," added Giles. Jadeja and Pant stitched a record sixth-wicket partnership of 222 runs, helping India rebuild after being reduced to 98/5.

346.title: It's my duty to appear if ED summons me, can come again: Sanjay Raut
