346.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said as a responsible citizen and Member of Parliament, it's his duty to appear if an investigative agency summons him. "Problem is with timing amid Maharashtra political crisis but they had doubts. Told them...I can come again if need be," Raut added. ED questioned Raut for 10 hours on Friday in a money laundering case.

347.title: Refused food on credit, man throws acid at sweet shop; 7 injured
347.article_body: Seven people were injured after a man allegedly threw acid at a sweetmeat stall in Haripur village of Jharkhand. According to police, after the shop owner refused to give him food on credit, the accused went home, returned with acid and threw it inside the shop. The injured people were taken to a local hospital.

348.title: India's largest floating solar power project fully operational in T'gana, pics released
348.article_body: India's largest floating solar power project is now fully operational, the government announced. The NTPC declared commercial operation of the final part capacity of 20 MW out of 100 MW Ramagundam Floating Solar PV Project at Ramagundam, Telangana with effect from July 1. The project spreads over 500 acres and is divided into 40 blocks.

349.title: Giant snail that can cause meningitis spotted in US county; quarantine ordered
349.article_body: A giant African land snail has been spotted in a Florida county, sending the area into quarantine. Giant African land snails can carry a parasite called rat lungworm, known to cause meningitis in humans and livestock, according to US Department of Agriculture. The snails can reach almost 8 inches long and 5 inches in diameter, the organisation said.

350.title: Entire budget of 'Shabaash Mithu' is equivalent to an A-lister's salary: Taapsee Pannu
350.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, in a recent interview, said that 'Shabaash Mithu' is her biggest budget film. She, however, added that the entire budget of the film is still equivalent to an A-lister's salary. "The situation is still like that. So, there is still a long way for us to go," she further stated, referring to pay disparity in Bollywood.

351.title: I was also offered to join rebel MLAs in Guwahati: Sena's Sanjay Raut
351.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that he was also offered to join the rebel MLAs in Guwahati. "I also got an offer for Guwahati but I follow Balasaheb Thackeray...so I didn't go there," he added. "When the truth is on your side, why fear?" Raut stated. Eknath Shinde, who was leading the rebel MLAs, became the new Maharashtra CM.

352.title: There is problem now: Chopra on Pujara being dismissed for 13(46)
352.article_body: After India batter Cheteshwar Pujara got dismissed for 13(46) in the fifth Test against England, former India cricketer Aakash Chopra said that "there is a problem now". "Pujara was going slowly-slowly, standing at one end...But the knock didn't last long. He again fell victim to James Anderson," Chopra said. He added, "Pujara is not getting his preferred No. 3 spot."

353.title: Can't get better than this: Ganguly on Pant-Jadeja's record stand
353.article_body: Reacting to the record sixth-wicket partnership of 222 runs between Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja in India's first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England, Sourav Ganguly tweeted, "Can't get better than this." "Special exhibition of Test match batting under pressure," he added. Sachin Tendulkar tweeted that Pant's 146 was "simply awesome", adding Jadeja played "amazing shots".

354.title: I hope both 'Raksha...' & 'Laal Singh...' do well at box office: Akshay
354.article_body: Akshay Kumar has opened up about the box office clash between his upcoming movie 'Raksha Bandhan' and Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "My film Welcome and his film Taare Zameen Par were released simultaneously. Both had done well. We are hoping that both...do well at the box office," he said. Both the films are scheduled to release on August 11.

355.title: Alt News' Zubair destroyed evidence, received donations from foreign nations: Police
355.article_body: The Delhi Police has added charges of criminal conspiracy and destruction of evidence in the case against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. The police also said that the accused received donations from foreign countries. "It was noticed that Twitter handles supporting Zubair after his arrest, were from Pakistan and mostly middle eastern countries," the police added.

356.title: Ukrainian borscht soup added to UNESCO endangered heritage list
356.article_body: UNESCO has added the cooking of Ukrainian borscht, a soup made of beetroot and other vegetables, to its list of endangered cultural traditions. The war in Ukraine has "threatened" the cooking of borscht, UNESCO said. Moscow decried the new protected Ukrainian status of the dish, which is also popular in Russia, saying the Russian version of borscht "doesn't need protection".

357.title: Was smoking a pipe, Dev Anand was impressed: Zeenat on bagging 'Hare...'
357.article_body: Zeenat Aman opened up about how she bagged the role of Janice in Dev Anand's 'Hare Rama Hare Krishna'. "I think he (Dev) was just impressed with the attitude and the persona I'd at that time," she said, adding, "I was smoking a pipe, wearing a skirt and he thought to himself that I would be perfect for the role."

358.title: 94% of new COVID-19 cases in Karnataka recorded in Bengaluru
358.article_body: Bengaluru on Friday reported 1,008 new coronavirus cases, which is nearly 94% of the total new cases recorded in Karnataka, according to official data. The city also recorded one death due to the virus the same day. The number of active clusters in Bengaluru fell to 13, however, the positivity rate rose to 4.24% as compared to a day earlier.

359.title: 1 injured as bike-borne man fires at pillion rider of another bike in Delhi
359.article_body: A firing incident was reported at 1:23 am on Saturday under Bindapur Police Station limits in Delhi, Dwarka district DCP said. "It's alleged...one of the two persons on a motorcycle fired on the pillion rider of another motorcycle, who is under treatment," the DCP added. "An attempt to murder case has been filed," the DCP further said.

360.title: Delhi Transport Dept gives nod to hike auto, taxi fares by ₹1.50 and ₹15
360.article_body: Delhi Transport Department gave its nod to hike fare prices of auto-rickshaws and taxis by ₹1.50 and ₹15 respectively per kilometre, officials said. The proposal will be tabled in the next cabinet meeting for a final nod, officials added. For AC taxis, meter charges will increase from ₹25 to ₹40 and for non-AC taxis from ₹14 to ₹17 per kilometre.

361.title: Centre promotes more than 8,000 govt employees in one go
361.article_body: The Centre ordered promotion of 8,089 employees belonging to Central Secretariat Service (CSS), Central Secretariat Stenographers' Service (CSSS) and Central Secretariat Clerical Service (CSCS) in one go. Of the 8,089, 4,734 are from CSS, 2,966 from CSSS and 389 from CSCS. "It was disheartening to see...employees [retiring]...without getting...due promotion," Minister Jitendra Singh tweeted.

362.title: Indian forces find 3-yr-old Pakistani boy at border, reunite him with family
362.article_body: A three-year-old Pakistani boy, who inadvertently reached the International Border in Punjab, has been handed over to his family by the Border Security Force. The incident was reported in Ferozepur sector of the state at around 7 pm on Friday when BSF troops noticed the child crying near the International Border fence.

363.title: Buses run on fuel generated from waste on pilot basis in Pune
363.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited on Friday plied buses running on compressed biogas (CBG) generated from wet waste from the city on a pilot basis. "It's a win-win situation as fuel is generated from waste and will help address Pune's garbage situation," Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said. In first trial, 10-15 buses will be run on CBG, PMC added.

364.title: Have utmost respect for religious beliefs: Samsung Pak after being accused of blasphemy
364.article_body: Samsung's Pakistan unit issued a statement as violent protests erupted in a Karachi mall after the multinational company was accused of blasphemy by a mob. Samsung said it "has utmost respect for all religious sentiments", adding that it has initiated a probe into the matter. Reportedly, over 20 Samsung employees were detained over this.

365.title: Criminal conspiracy, evidence destruction charges added against Alt News Co-founder
365.article_body: Delhi Police has added criminal conspiracy and the destruction of evidence charges in the case against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. "The accused received donations from foreign countries," it added. In the FIR, Section 35 in The Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 2010, has now been added. Zubair was arrested in a case related to an alleged objectionable tweet in 2018.

366.title: 15 kg tumour removed from woman’s abdomen at Patna hospital
366.article_body: An ovarian tumour, weighing about 15 kg, was surgically removed from the abdomen of a 40-year-old woman at a government hospital in Patna. The patient was admitted to Nalanda Medical College and Hospital with abdominal pain and swelling complaints. "The tumour was...largest ever to have been surgically extracted in our department," the doctor who headed the surgery said.

367.title: Punjab man stabs 11-yr-old boy to death over minor argument; held
367.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed an 11-year-old boy to death following a minor argument in Punjab's Ludhiana. The boy was selling boiled eggs on a cart near his house when the incident occurred, according to police. The deceased's mother claimed that onlookers had caught the accused, who was holding a "blood-soaked knife in his hand".

368.title: Colombia extradites sister of accused drug cartel leader to US
368.article_body: Colombia has extradited the sister of accused drug cartel leader Dairo Usaga to the US to face drug trafficking charges, police said. Colombian police accuse Nini Usaga of money laundering for the Clan del Golfo cartel and coordinating drug shipments abroad. Her brother, accused head of Clan del Golfo, was extradited to face drug trafficking charges in US in May.

369.title: 5 killed, 12 injured as earthquake of 6.0 magnitude hits Iran
369.article_body: At least five people have been killed and 12 others have been injured after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake hit southern Iran on Saturday, state television reported. Rescue teams have been deployed near the epicentre Sayeh Khosh village, home to around 300 people. Iran's deadliest quake was a 7.4-magnitude tremor that struck in 1990, killing 40,000 people in the country's north.

370.title: Fabulous given India were 98/5: Bishop on Pant-Jadeja's record stand
370.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said the partnership of 222 runs between Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja in India's first innings of the fifth rescheduled Test against England was "fabulous", considering India were 98/5. Their partnership is India's highest-ever stand for the sixth-wicket against England in Test cricket. Pant scored 146 runs while Jadeja is currently unbeaten on 83 runs.

371.title: He has put India so far ahead in the 5th Test: Agarkar on Pant's 146
371.article_body: Former India pacer Ajit Agarkar said Rishabh Pant's 146 in India's first innings of the fifth rescheduled Test against England has put his team "so far ahead" in the ongoing match. "[Pant's style of play] shouldn't come as a surprise. It is...good for India that he has kept repeating it," added Agarkar. "Pant came into the Test...being...under pressure," stated Agarkar.

372.title: PM can't change my behaviour by making me sit in ED office: Rahul
372.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who was questioned recently by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case, said that PM Modi cannot change his behaviour by making him sit in the ED office for five days. "This is a confusion in...mind of the Prime Minister," he added. "My behaviour...can never be shaped by my opponents or...enemies," Rahul further said.

373.title: Manipur landslide worst incident in state's history: CM as death toll rises to 20
373.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Friday said that the landslide in Noney was the "worst incident" in the state's history. This comes as the death toll from the incident rose to 20, according to an Indian Army statement. The CM added that 81 people were lost in the landslide, of which 18 were rescued and 55 are still trapped.

374.title: Saviour has spoken: Arjun after Kartik praises trailer of Ek Villain Returns
374.article_body: Kartik Aaryan took to his Instagram Stories to praise the trailer of Arjun Kapoor's upcoming movie 'Ek Villain Returns', writing, "Superb Trailer. Killing It With The Villains. Mohit Suri sir (director) your world is fantastic as always." Arjun wrote, "Saviour has spoken," reacting to Kartik's post. Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' earned more than ₹200 crore at the worldwide box office.

375.title: What multiple records did Rishabh Pant break with his 146(111) against England?
375.article_body: Rishabh Pant set the record for smashing the fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, taking 89 deliveries during the fifth Test against England. During his 111-ball 146-run knock, Pant also became the youngest Indian to reach 100 sixes in international cricket aged 24 years and 271 days. He also became the youngest wicketkeeper-batter to reach 2,000 Test runs.

376.title: What alternatives can be adopted in daily life as single-use plastic banned in India?
376.article_body: The government has shared some alternatives that can be adopted in daily life as single-use plastic has been banned in India. Khadi bags, bamboo straws and cutlery, stainless steel straws, fluid ear care products and reusable glasses and cups are among the alternatives. Bamboo stirrers and stainless steel lunch boxes can also be used as alternatives.

377.title: Building used as office, not residence: UP govt on Prayagraj demolition
377.article_body: Commenting on demolition of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad's house, Uttar Pradesh government said that the building was not being used for residential purposes but as the office of the Welfare Party of India. It added that the demolition was not connected to the June 10 Prayagraj violence. Javed's wife has moved Allahabad HC claiming the demolition to be illegal.

378.title: 30-yr-old man gets 1-yr jail for shouting ‘I love you’ at minor in Mumbai
378.article_body: A 30-year-old man was sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment for shouting 'I love you' at a 13-year-old girl in 2015. The convict, who lived in the girl's neighbourhood, stalked her for about 15 days. A complaint was lodged against him after he tried to come close to her while she was once returning home with her mother after buying textbooks.

379.title: Shinde, Fadnavis will bring Maha back on track of development: Scindia
379.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Friday welcomed the formation of a new government in Maharashtra under rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde. "I'm confident Shinde as CM and Devendra Fadnavis as Deputy CM will bring Maharashtra back on...road of development," Scindia added. He claimed that the previous MVA government was acting like a speed-breaker in Maharashtra's development.

380.title: Delhi Fire Services to get 89 new additional fire trucks
380.article_body: The Delhi Fire Services (DFS) will soon get 89 new additional fire trucks as the department is currently in the process of purchasing them, officials said. It will help DFS improve their response time and overcome the shortage of fire tenders, DFS Chief Atul Garg said. Notably, DFS' 60 diesel-based fire trucks have reached their expiry time of 10 years.

381.title: India reports 17,092 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,09,568
381.article_body: India has reported 17,092 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 17,070 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,09,568, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,168, according to the latest data.

382.title: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows files for Chapter 15 bankruptcy in US
382.article_body: Cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC) has filed for Chapter 15 of the US Bankruptcy Code, which allows foreign debtors to shield US assets. Singapore-based 3AC is one of the highest-profile investors hit by the sharp sell-off in cryptocurrency markets. Notably, the company had reportedly managed an estimated $10 billion in assets as recently as March.

383.title: J&K Police help Amarnath pilgrims cross flooded bridges, share videos
383.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Friday shared videos of its rescue teams helping pilgrims travelling to Amarnath cave cross two bridges that had got blocked and flooded amid heavy rains. A video shows the police officers standing in a queue as they helped people cross while heavy water flowed. The bridges were located at Brari Marg and Y junction.

384.title: Hope Rocketry becomes as successful as Kashmir Files: Vivek Agnihotri
384.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has reacted to an article saying R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' has the advantage of good word-of-mouth, and is likely to repeat the success of the former's 'The Kashmir Files'. "From the bottom of my heart, I wish this happens and I'm sure it'll happen because Madhavan is one of the most honest [actors]," Vivek said.

385.title: Chef from Taj used to cook for him: Manoj Pahwa recalls eating with Rishi
385.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has said Rishi Kapoor asked him to eat with him during the shoot of 'Mulk' in Lucknow. "A chef from Taj hotel used to cook for him...Being a Kapoor, his food was spread out on the entire table," he added. "There were four types of mutton, four kinds of chicken, five kinds of sweets," Manoj further said.

386.title: Delhi Police arrest murderer absconding for last 15 years
386.article_body: In a 15-year-old kidnapping and murder case, the Delhi Police have arrested the main suspect after hunting him since 2007. The suspect, Hari Om, is accused of abducting and killing a man, Mahesh Choudhary, with the help of his friend, Rakesh, near a village in Kanpur. Notably, Om was arrested from his residence in Kanpur Dehat's Jathiapur village, police said.

387.title: Smoke spotted inside Delhi-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight while it was passing 5,000 feet
387.article_body: A Delhi-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight returned to the Delhi airport after the crew noticed smoke inside the plane while passing 5,000 feet. All the passengers were safely disembarked, a SpiceJet spokesperson said. The SG 2962 flight had taken off at around 6.30 am today and was originally scheduled to reach Jabalpur at around 8 am.

388.title: Bezos' superyacht stuck as firm decides against dismantling bridge to let it sail
388.article_body: Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht is stuck after the Dutch firm building it decided against dismantling a bridge following public backlash, Dutch news outlet Trouw reported. Oceanco had earlier said it needed to have the bridge taken apart in order to allow the superyacht to sail. Trouw used freedom of information legislation to find out more about the firm's plan.

389.title: Public toilet caretaker gets life term for raping 9-yr-old girl in Mumbai
389.article_body: A 25-year-old public toilet caretaker was sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a 9-year-old girl inside the toilet where he worked. The girl said that on November 5, 2019, when she was about to exit the toilet after using it, the convict entered inside and assaulted her sexually. He allegedly gave her ₹20 and threatened her to not reveal anything.

390.title: 46-yr-old man arrested for raping niece for past 5 years in Mumbai
390.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested a 46-year-old man for allegedly sexually exploiting his niece for the past five years. The accused initially raped the 20-year-old victim at a hotel in Andheri and subsequently raped her on multiple occasions at various places, police said. "The accused is said to have videographed some of the acts," said Assistant Police Inspector Santosh Kamble.

391.title: Pak journalist attacked after calling Army generals 'property dealers'
391.article_body: A 73-year-old Pakistan journalist was allegedly assaulted by unidentified men in Lahore on Friday night, a day after calling Pakistan's Army generals "property dealers". Ayaz Amir said the unidentified men dragged him out of his car, hit him and tore his clothes. Ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan condemned the incident, saying, "Pakistan is descending into the worst kind of fascism."

392.title: Stokes ran out of ideas, Eng bowlers lost patience: Zaheer on Day 1
392.article_body: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan said England Test captain Ben Stokes "ran out of ideas" at one stage on Day 1 of the fifth rescheduled Test against India. "The England bowlers lost their patience...After tea...they pitched it either too full or too short. England had to bring in the spinners because of the poor run rate and...tiring pacers," he added.

393.title: Rajasthan government suspends Udaipur ASP days after tailor's beheading
393.article_body: Rajasthan government on Friday suspended Udaipur Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP) Ashok Meena days after a tailor, identified as Kanhaiya Lal, was beheaded by two men. Notably, the order issued by the Joint Secretary (Police) of the state home department does not mention the reason for suspension. Earlier, Rajasthan Police suspended an Assistant Sub-Inspector and a station house officer.

394.title: Pak tech body warns of internet shutdown amid power outages, later deletes tweet
394.article_body: Amid frequent power outages due to the country's economic crisis, Pakistan's National Information Technology Board (NIBT) tweeted that the telecom operators in the country have warned about shutting down mobile and internet services. It added that the long hours of power outages have caused hindrance in their operations. However, NIBT later deleted this tweet.

395.title: If India win the Test, it will be his best knock ever: Jaffer on Pant's 146
395.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's 146 in India's first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England, Wasim Jaffer said, "If India...win the Test and series, this will stand on top of everything (Pant's best knocks)." "It is hard to put anything in front of that [89* at the] Gabba," added Jaffer. Pant's 146 comprised 20 fours and four sixes.

396.title: There was fear of riots under Congress rule in Gujarat: Amit Shah
396.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that people feared riots during Jagannath Rath Yatra under Congress rule in Gujarat. "During Congress rule in Gujarat, have you seen any Rath Yatra procession that has gone smoothly?" Shah asked. "Such incidents of violence occurred back then. Twice, the Lord's [Jagannath] chariot [for the Yatra] was taken away," he added.

397.title: 4 villages to get sewer lines, 3 lakh people to benefit: Delhi Dy CM
397.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that four villages and 36 unauthorised colonies in the national capital will get sewer lines, following which around three lakh people will benefit. The areas include Bijwasan, Najafgarh, Shikarpur, Burari and Sangam Vihar. "Currently, sewage from these areas is discharged into local ponds...which later goes indirectly into the Yamuna," Sisodia added.

398.title: Bengaluru police arrest Nigerian national, seize ₹20 lakh-drugs
398.article_body: A 34-year-old Nigerian national was arrested for allegedly selling prohibited drugs in Bengaluru, DCP (South Division) P Krishnakant tweeted on Friday. The police also seized drugs worth ₹20 lakh, cash, a two-wheeler and a phone from the accused's possession. The accused had come to India on a business visa three years ago and lives a luxurious life, the police said.

399.title: Google to delete users' location history if they visit US abortion clinics
399.article_body: Google has announced it would delete users' location history if they visit US abortion clinics, domestic violence shelters and other places where privacy is sought. This comes a week after the US Supreme Court rolled back abortion rights. Without giving a reference to abortion, Google said it will continue to push back against improper demands for data by the government.

400.title: Hyd will be renamed Bhagyanagar if BJP elected in T'gana: BJP leader
400.article_body: BJP leader and former Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad's name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana. "They [TRS government] don't think about the welfare of the people of Telangana. So people are in favour of BJP," Das claimed. PM Modi will address the national executive meeting to end the dynasty politics, he added.
